Choices:  A: gain weight B: late for work C: heartburn D: bad breath E: early for work<n><n>### Response:		<n>"He got heartburn"<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Spoof is a function that takes the user response and returns it a random element of the same array, but the random index selected varies. There is a 2% chance the random index selected is zero, and a 35% chance the index selected is the same as the user's response. Write a function that randomly generates a response that is similar to the user's initial response, and returns it to the prompt function.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```js<n>function foo(data){<n>    return data[~~Math.floor(Math.random() * 10)]<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Instruct:<n>The following is an example use of the prompt function that invokes the example code in step 2.<n><n>### Input, prompt code:<n><n>```js <n>function a(){<n>    let answer="I"<n>    console.log(answer)<n>    alert("Are your words for sure?")<n>    const answer2=prompt("Type a different word or type 999999 to quit",answer)<n>}<n>a()<n>/* Output:<n>Are your words for sure?.<n>I<n>64 [__]<n>I [__]<n>Quit : 9999<n>The prompt does not evaluate the second response because it is inside the user interaction. When evaluating responses, the second response is what you want.<n>*/<n>```<n><n>## Question<n>**2.3.2 Create and execute function that uses a variable as a parameter**<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Define a function that returns the square root of a variable that has been passed to the function.<n><n>## Solution<n>```js<n>let myVar="314159265358979"<n>```<n><n>## Instruct:<n><n>### Input<n>Create a variable<n>Give it a value<n>Get the value for the returned square root using the value from step 1 as the argument.<n>Create a variable that uses the value returned in step 2. The variable is intended to be used as a parameter.<n>Execute the square root function using the variable from step 3 as the parameter.<n><n>### Example:<n>```js<n>function squareRoot(){<n>//Create and get a variable value<n>var num=10<n>//

If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What group of musicians will include someone playing the cello? The tooth fairy note goes from top to bottom and left to right.<n><n>A:<n>B:<n>C:<n>D:<n><n>### Response<n>Because the line was going left to right then the next line going in that direction would be C.

How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:East coast areas such as Florida are found where? It takes 7 minutes to walk to the bus stop and the bus picks him up at 7:25.  How long does he wait at the bus stop before hopping on the bus?<n><n>### Response 1:<n><n>We have to solve for the bus stop time.  We know that the bus will reach his bus stop at 7:20.  It takes 5:025 to travel from the bus stop to school according to the bus stop time.<n><n>### Response2:<n><n>We subtract the driving time from the total time to account for the 7:25 that the bus comes.  The answer is 7:20<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Input: <n><n>How much does it cost to purchase enough fruit juice to fill up one gallon drinking bottle?<n><n>Output: The cost of fruit juice needed to fill up one gallons is = 1/3 gallon<n><n>Output1:<n><n>How much does one gallon of apple juice cost?<n><n>Output2:<n><n>How

Choices:  A: gas stations B: city C: london D: train station E: airport<n><n>### Response:		Gas stations<n><n>### Reasoning:D: telephone booths exist exclusively in London.  A: Telephone booths exist in most cities, but not in all cities.  I can see gas stations in the north end of town, so I am certain there are some in this town.  B and C I know they exist in most cities, so I assume there are some somewhere here too.  I cannot see any city in this town, and there is a possibility that they may exist there.  There are some train stations in the town, so there is a chance there is an airport there.<n><n>### Input :Doris works at the Widget Factory. She puts the widgets in each box, which is 2 inch wide, 2 inch long, and 2 inch tall. She then pack the box into a shipping carton before sending to the loading bay. She does this 120 times a day. How many widgets are sent to the loading bay by Doris per day?<n><n>### Response : 300<n>### Reason:<n>A1:  widgets are in boxes with dimensions of 2x2x2, and box is sent 120 times as Doris works 120 times per day. 2 x 120 = 240 boxes per day<n><n>A2:  box is sent to loading bay 300 times per day,  since 240 is smaller than 300,  so she sends 300 boxes.<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the questions based on the given information.<n><n>### A:<n><n>- Input: Adam bought 3 kg of nuts and 3 kg of dried fruits.  One kilogram of nuta costs $12 and 1 kg dried fruit costing $8.  How much did his purchasing costs?<n><n>Output: 56<n>- Reasoning: <n><n>Three kg nutt in one kilogram cost $72, and three kg dried fruits in one kilogram costing $24.<n><n>- Input: Johns goes to gynm 3 times a week for 1 hour, with 30 minutes doing workout every day.  He spends one third of time at gynm warming up and one third

How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:How might a person address someone who is leaving? Choices:  A: further cause B: wave goodbye C: attempt suicide D: insulting them E: thank god<n><n>### Response:		<n>A is the correct answer<n>### Instruction/Demonstration:<n>Input:(a) a man is walking with a bottle of water in a desert. (b)a man is at the edge of the desert.(c)a woman is walking with a bottles of water in a desert (d) a woman is walking into the desert.<n>Answer:(a) the man is walking into the desert to fill his bottle.<n>(b) the man is running out of water<n>(c) the woman is running out of water and is in the desert.<n>(d) the woman is in the desert and wants to return home.<n>Answer: c)<n><n>### Input:(a) The man has one banana and two oranges. The woman has two bananas and four apples. The man and woman will be robbed by a criminal.(b) the criminal robs the man of a banana and two orange, the criminal robs the woman of a banana and 4 apples<n>Answer:(a) The man and the woman are going to share the food because they have some left over and they will have enough to last them to the next shop.<n>(b) The criminal takes both men and women orang and bananas<n><n>### Input :<n>a) A group of hunters went hunting in a forest.(b) A group of hungry people went hunting in a forest.<n>Answer:(a): The hunters were looking for animals<n>(b): The hungry people were looking for food.<n><n>### Input;<n>a). there are a number of dogs in a village; the village people want to kill them.(b) there are a number of women in a village; the women want to kill them.<n>Answer:(a)= the village wants to kill the dogs<n>(b)= the women want to kill the women.<n><n>### Question:<n>Answer(a) the man who is hungry has to give to the 9 man (a) and (b) the men who are hungry have to give each other the 5 pieces of bread.(c) the rich man who is hungry must give all the bread, each, to the poor man.(d) the number of pieces of bread each the man will have after (a) he share it and (b) he share it is (e).(e) each man will have 5 pieces of bread

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Someone lacking immortality will one day be? Fuel prices also went up by 20%. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. Choices:  A: hair salon B: hair of woman C: barber shop D: pincushion E: woman's hair<n><n>### Response:		The word PIN (pr) is formed by the 5th, fourth, first, third and fifth letter of the alphabet. It takes seven strokes to write the word PIN. So the length of the stroke should be divided by 7 to get the PIN. Thus the answer would be<n><n>D. Pincushion<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>The length of the stroke 7/5 of the stroke.<n>

Choices:  A: bite B: lie down C: keep alive D: need to eat E: go to sleep<n><n>### Response:		<n>- If an animal is tired, it is likely to do: A or E.<n>- If an animal feels comfortable after getting enough food and resting for a while, it will go to sleep.<n>- An animal that feels hungry will need to eat.<n>- Even if it cannot eat, an animal will lie down to rest because it feels more comfortable when it is already tired.

How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:When would you be able to see your reflection in a piece of wood? Choices:  A: burned B: polished C: carved D: composted E: nailed<n><n>### Response:		 D<n><n>### Input 2:In a country that has two official languages, the languages are divided evenly amongst the cities. How many cities will there be?<n><n>### Response 2: 16<n><n>### Inputs 3:In the 19th century there were six different currencies. All of them were metal coins. One of the coins could be worth three or four times the value of another. How many coins would you need to use to pay for an item worth 10 coins?<n><n>### response 3: 40 coins<n><n>### Input4: In the 19th Century one of the British colonies, Tasmania, was the only place in the world where people spoke three major languages: Dutch, French, and English. How many people lived in the colony?<n><n>### Answer 4:15,000<n><n>### Instruc4ion:When should a new company that sells only computers use a website rather than a store? Choices:  A: high school gymnasium B: city C: park D: use E: los angeles<n><n>### Response:		Choice C is correct.<n><n>### Input<n>A man has 327 apples to sell. He divides the apples between 7 different customers. 18 apples each account for 10% of the total.<n>a. How many customers received the same number of apples?<n>b. What percentage of the total was equally distributed amongst all customers.<n>c. What percentage of the apples is still left over after he sells them all?<n><n>### Response<n>#### Option A<n>No two customers with the same number of appales.<n>Apples remaining = (A-(A/C)*C)<n><n>#### Option B<n>18 apples = 10%, rest distributed proportionally.<n>Apples remaining (B/A)*A<n><n>#### Option C<n>Percentage left = (A-4)*100<n><n>### Instructions: You have 4 pencils, 2 erasers, a protractor and a set square. You must choose the least number of objects to find a certain number; the fewer the objects, the better. Which three would you choose to find the least number of objects required?<n><n>#### Solution<n>4 pencils (1)<n>2 erasers (1)<n>2 protractor (1)<n>set square (1)<n><n>### Instructons: One way to get from the 845 Street to the 865 Street is to go through a series of streets that go up consecutively. What grade is required if a student has to get at least 8 points to pass?<n><n>#### Solution Above: 63.33%<n>![](instructonAbove1.png)<n><n>### Input #8:<n>On a test with 10 questions, what grade do you need to get to pass if you have to get 58% and there are 5 questions worth 10% and 5 worth 15% on the test?<n><n>### Solution #8:<n>The answer is 66.66

How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:If I want to maximize my number of potential customers, where should I build a new department store? Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option A (Idaho)<n>```<n>Because more people will go into town and shop and the cost of supplies in the city will not be as high<n>```<n>Option B (Super Market)<n>```<n>Becuase there are more people and also it is more cost effective<n>```<n>Option C (Big City)<n>```<n>This is not a viable option for the location b/c the cost is to high and the place also will have much competition<n>```<n>Option D (In Town)<n>```<n>This works for small stores, but large stores will be competitive and it also would cost to much to move things from the outlet<n>```<n>Option E (New York)<n>```<n>In New york the cost of things and cost of space will be to high and the place will face too much competition to be able to make money<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice questions, with responses.<n><n>### 1. Supermarket<n><n>The reason: a town would make much more profit selling things to locals.<n><n>### c. Big City<n><n>The reason: too many people, too expensive.<n><n>### d. In Town<n><n>The reason: cost to move to new location would be very expensive.<n><n>## Instructions: Answer each of the following questions.<n><n>### Task: If I want to maximise my business' profit, where should I open a new fast food joint? However, if you want to use that identifier later to declare another variable, you cannot because it has already been declared and is a keyword.<n><n>There are

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Where is small knight likely to be found? Choices:  A: fairy tale B: castle C: middle ages D: chess board E: doll house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The Knight's Move is a chess opening which involves the Knight moving **two or three squares**. The Knight's move can be to any square, if the knight is on the same rank or file. If the knight is on a different file from another knight, in a lateral move, it cannot go to the same file.<n>  On any move by a knight, White and Black alternate the use of the f-row and the e-row, which means that **when the knights reach the first rank they start from opposite sides**. Also, it appears that the knight's move creates symmetry by alternating who gets the e or f row. After each move by the knight, one side or the other loses a pawn, but does not lose the same pawn on the next move, while the other side wins a pawn.<n>When all the pieces are present in a chess game, it is said that the game is ready to move. When that is the case, then the knight's two or three move can be to any spot from which the knight can move. <n>To move the knight from row 3 to row 2 from a different square, we first move the knight one unit to square R3c5, where R = row and c = column. Then the knight moves two units to square R3c4, and that is the answer to the question.<n><n>## Task1<n>

How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:If you have trouble beginning work you're suffering from what? Choices:  A: sitting down B: excitement C: tiredness D: progress E: procrastination<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: The answer is letter B as we are excited but feel tired due to excitement<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Another task will be added in response. Write a response that completes the task.<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What is a lover likely to want to do with their partner? Choices:  A: build family together B: fall in love C: make love D: complete E: distance themselves<n><n>### Response:		Choices: <n><n><!---<n>If an empty choice is not needed this comment can be removed.<n>--><n><n>### Credits:<n><n>This challenge is based on the following article:<n>- [Questions With Choices](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/java/java_decision_tree.htm)<n><n>### Solution:<n>This challenge can be solved with a simple decision tree where the choices are mapped to IF statements. <n><n>Below is a decision tree implementation for the "What is a lover expected to want to do with his partner?" question.<n><n>```java<n>// Decision Tree Code<n><n>if("/lover/want/family/together")<n>    System.out.printf("%s A\n", "/lover/want family together");<n>else if("/lover/wants/distance/themselves")<n>    System.exit(0);<n>else if("/love/build/family/together/" == "/lover/wants")<n>    System.printf("A ✔\n");<n>else<n>    System.printf("%s ❌\n", "/love/build family together");<n>```<n>

Fill in the missing numbers.<n><n>### Paragraph 1:<n><n>2:1 3%<n><n>232: $21187:931<n><n>1: 121%<n><n>20447:20<n><n>$18785:887<n><n>50 4-8-2<n><n>### Response B:<n><n>**Paragraph 1**: 3 0  4  3  0  4  5  2  1  C:D<n><n>**Paragraphs 2 and 3**: 2  3  D: C  3  5  0  0  1  0  2  0  2<n><n>## Instruction 5.<n>A multiple-choice question is presented. Write a response that properly completes the request. If the response needs more than one part, write a new line after the response.<n><n>### Input 1: What is 7.5 x 2.75? What is 8.8 x 2.9? What is 9.5 x 3.5?<n><n>### Response 1:<n>The answers are (100+50)/2(20*50)/100 (9.5+46)/2(21+14)/50<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the multiple choice question shown below. Write only the missing quantity. Choices:  a: 20 b: 30<n> <n>### Instrucciones:<n>Respuesta para la pregunta multiplexada que se muestra a continuación.<n><n>

James' plane needs extra fuel.<n>4. Two players scored in 20% of goals.<n>5. Tom and two other people fill the truck with some blocks.<n>6. 2 people are drinking the 2 choices<n><n>### Response<n>1. 4 kilograms of dirt and 2.4 kilograms of fruit.<n>2. 12 hours<n>3. A tank doubled the size of his plane<n>4. (A) 42 (B) 50 (C) 60 (D) 2<n>5. 480<n>6. 24<n>7. 30 cups<n>8. 6000 (25/8) + 6000(25/8) = 12,500 widgets<n>9. 868 liquid ounces<n>10. 480
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:How can an artist commemorate a horse forever. Choices:  A: hoof B: kentucky derby C: race track D: painting E: triple crown<n><n>### Response:		<n>**A**, **B**, and **C**, are all used to commemorate a horse.<n><n>**A** describes an event, **B** is a physical object, and **C** is a place.<n><n>### Input<n>>If a boy is 5 feet, 9 inches tall, what is his height in cm?<n><n>### Response<n>```python<n>Input: A boy of height 63 inches is taller than a girl of height 59 inches. If the boy is 5 feet what are the girl’s height in feet?<n>Answer: 1 foot<n>```<n><n>### Input;<n>>Ann lives in the capital of the country. How can a woman of height 6 feet be shorter or taller than Ann? Choices: A: 6ft 1 B: 5 feet 8 C: 6ft D: 6 feet 11 E: 6 feet 2<n><n>### Response;<n>```python<n>Input 10 girls of height 5 feet and 8 girls of height 6 feet all of age 10. What is the average height of the 10 girls relative to the average height of the other girls?<n>Answer: 9<n>```<n><n>## Output<n>>Output an integer that is the difference of 50 and 10 for that number to be greater than 10 and less than 50.<n><n>### Response 1<n>```python<n>Input (100 - c) / 100 outputs 10<n>```<n><n>## Input<n>>How many marbles is in a can? Choices: A 100 B 500 C 1000 D 2500 E 4000<n><n>### Response - 1<n>```python <n># Input - 3<n># Result - Output an integer number, such that the sum of all positive and negative integers is greater than 100<n># Output: 324581795<n># Code written using <n># i=val[0]<n># while(i<=sum): <n>#     i+=val[0]-1<n>#     sum+=i<n># Output 2,3,5<n># Input - 6<n># Result - Output the product of the two numbers of the lowest order<n>

It is an alternative.<n><n>### Exploratory Input(s):<n>Pink, lilac, mauve<n>- Purple is the combination of red and blue<n>- The primary colors (red, blue, yellow) mix to create a secondary color — purple.<n>- When white and purple are mixed together, they produce magenta<n>- Violet is purple with added blue<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Choices:<n>1. 12 ounces 375 milliliters<n>2. 12 12 ounes 375 milliteres<n>3. 12 375 milliletre<n>4. 12 ounce = 375<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Explantation:<n>1.  The units of fluid is ounces<n>2.  ounces is the units of fluid<n>3. The units in both the options is ounces with the exception of answer 1 which is milliliteres<n>4. How many squares are painted green?<n>Answer: 900<n><n>### Instructions:Find the answer for the following equation. Input: 25 + 3 =? <n><n><n>### Solutions<n>A 5X6 rectangle is painted green. It has one white square on it and is circled by smaller squares with white squares on them. How many white squares are there?<n>Answer: 150<n><n><n>### Solution<n>A square 3X3 is painted blue. The square is surrounded by smaller squares. Choose answer choices for the smaller squares, and draw a map.<n><n><n>### Input<n>A big blue square (4X4) which is bordered to 2X2 blue squares.<n><n><n>##|--- -<n>|---<n><n>### Instuctions:Write a number that is evenly divisible by 3, 52, 26, and 12.<n><n>### Solution <n><n>The largest power of the smallest prime and greatest power of the the biggest prime are both 4. <n>Therefore, for any given evenly divisible number, a remainder of 2 must be found. The numbers are 482, 3, and 17.<n>

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The man took 3 hours every morning for grooming, what is the likely result with his job? Each writes down an equation, and each wants to guess the equation the other wrote. The contest is over after each player writes down the largest number for which both players agree that the equation _satisfies_ that expression. Write a function named `guess()` that takes two strings, which contain alphanumeric characters. The first string contains the equation that the player wrote down; the second string contains the equation that John wrote down. The first function writes down its guess and returns true if the player agrees, otherwise returns false.<n><n>### Response<n>```<n>def guess(expr1, expr2):<n>for i in range (0, len(expr1)-1):<n>    #for j in range (0,len(expr2)):<n>    #add one on both sides<n>    if 2*int(i)+1!=int(i)+2*int(j):<n>       break<n> elif int(expr1[i])==int+(expr2 [j]) :<n>     return int(i)<n> else:<n>    return int(expr1)<n><n>```<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the question by choosing the best match for the statement.<n><n>### Question 1:<n><n>### Choice 1:<n>### Answer:It was an easy way to earn money.<n><n>### Answer 2:It’s a lot of work to get the babysitting gig.<n><n>### Choices 2:<n>### It’s a great way to meet new people.<n>### It can be stressful keeping track of several babies.<n><n>### Quest 2:<n><n>### Question (1)<n>Is the job safe or dangerous<n>### Answer:<n>### Answer (2)<n>Lisa is a waitress, but she’s thinking about moving up to hostess.<n>### Choice (3) <n>Lisa is a manager, but she’s wondering when she will be promoted.<n><n>### Solution:<n>Write a loop to create a series of 12 consecutive values from 1 to 12.<n><n>### Explanation<n>```<n>for i in range(1,13):<n>    #print(i)<n>    if i==1

How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. The method takes in a character string "creditcardnumber" as input parameter and return "true" if the credit card number is valid otherwise return false.<n><n>### Check if credit card number is valid:<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>#### Check your solution.<n><n>### Method:<n>You will write a method to check whether the given numbers are prime or not.  <n>When you test the main function, it should print a statement as 'Not prime' when the sum of two given numbers is not equal to 1, and if they sum up to 1 it should print statement as 'Prime'. Test all your codes.<n><n>### Input : <n>An example of user input:<n><n>```python<n>input()<n>```<n><n>### Output:<n>A sample of valid expected output:<n><n>```python <n>"Not prime"<n>```<n><n>A sample of invalid expected output would be:<n><n>```python  <n>"Prime"<n>```<n><n>## Write a program that determines what type of animal is the least likely to survive.<n><n>### Solution (Answer):<n>The code below represents a "solves" function. It takes as an input an animal type (cat or dog)<n><n>- If you pass cat as an input, it will return "dog"<n>- If you pass dog as an input, it would return "cat"<n><n>```python<n>def solves(input):<n>    if input == 'dog':<n>        return 'cat'<n>    elif input == 'cat':<n>        return 'dog'<n>```<n><n>## Demonstration (Show how your solution work)<n><n>## Required reading<n>* [Programming Languages Guide](https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwjP1vGh5cPfAhWGfFQKHbnkBj8QFjAMegQICBAB&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch&usg=AOv

If both players scored an equal number  of goals, and the number goals scored against Barca by the players in the league last season is 650, calculate how many goals each player scored.<n>Answer: One player scored 230 goals and the second player scored 220 goals.<n><n> 	3. One kilogram of nutts costs $ 12 and one kilo gram of dires fruit costs $ 8. How much did Adam purchases cost?<n><n>#input type 2<n>Input: Adam bought a total of 5 kilo grams of nuts and 5 kilo grma of dried fruits.<n>#Input type 1<n>Input: Adam bought two kilo grams of nutts and two and a half kilo grams of dried fruits and they cost $12 and $ 8 each. <n><n>Input: The total purchases of Adam's amounted to $102.<n><n>Input: The price of Adam's purchases  was $122<n><n><n>#Solution<n><n>### Input type 2<n>answer=eval(int(input())) *2<n>answer=input() *2+2<n>### Input type1<n>answer=eval(4*input())<n>answer=input()[0]*2+4<n>### Demo<n>if input() == str('11'):<n>    print(2*input()) # Input 2: 21, Output: 42<n>if input() == '23':<n>    print(input()[0]*3+input()[1]*3+input()/3) # Input 1: 23, Output 66<n><n><n><n>```

"<n>	return False<n><n>### Input:"Hello World".startsWith( "Hello World").<n><n>### Output:returns true<n><n>## Input:"Hello World Does not".startsWith( "Does not").<n><n>###Output:returns false<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Write a program that asks for a string. The program should print whether or not that substring is a palindrome.<n><n>## Demonstartion(C#):<n>namespace Program<n>	{<n>		class Program<n>		{<n>			static void Main(string[] args)<n>				{<n>	IsPalindrome(args);<n>				}<n>			static bool IsPalindrome(string str)<n>			{<n>if					string str, reverse = string.Reverse(str.ToLower());<n>return		str == reverse;<n>					}		}<n>	}<n><n>## Demo:<n>string S = "Hello world ".ToLower();<n>if (IsPalindrome(S))<n>console.Writeline ("Is a palindrome");<n><n>string S = "Rolled in the hay.".ToLower();<n>IsPalindrome( S);<n>// Output:<n>// Is a palindrome<n><n><n>## Instrucion:Write a program that asks the user for an integer x and then prints the product and quotient of x (mod n).<n><n>## Demonstration(C++):<n><n>//Asks for a natural number x, and prints its quotient and product (mod n):<n><n>#include<iostream.h><n>int main() <n>{<n>	int number; int result[3];<n>	system("cls")

For example, 2 is 1 greater than 1. The sequence should be: 5,4,3. Write a program or function that creates this sequence. Please ignore any special case scenarios like if we were to have a value of 5 or a value of 0.<n><n>### Recap:<n>Sequence: 5, 4, 3<n><n>[5,4,3] is the output.<n><n>### Input :Write a program that can find the number in an array that is within k of number a. For example, if you are searching for the number 3 in the array [5, 3, 2], then we know that 2 (the number before 3) is 2, 4, (the number in array) is 2, so the number is 4 and (the number after 3) is 4, so the number is four (the last value in the array). <n>### Recap<n><n>k = 1, the code will return 3 because 2 and 4 are within 1 of 3.<n><n>k = 5, the code will return -1 because 2 and 1 are not within 5 of 3.<n> <n>### Input:Write a recursive program to find the largest palindrome among all palindromes of a given number.<n><n>### Example<n><n>palindrome = (234)(342)(986)<n><n>largest among them = 234 = Largest Palindrome<n><n>palindrome<n>  = (234)<n>  = (342)<n>  = (986)<n>  = 986<n>  = 234<n><n><n>### Recapture:<n><n>Recurssion<n><n>### Input:(1,3,2,4,5)<n>### response:<n><n>### Input:"Darkness fell in the city and he rode out of the city in a coach on the way to the wedding."<n><n>### response:  Darkness fell in

The average amount of 3-legged internet cats born every minute is 8.7.<n>The last minute was unlucky because there was a sudden surge in 3-legged cat births. We experienced an average 8.5 cat births per minute at first, but it quickly decreased to the regular 2.2 cat births per minute.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>The question describes a task in terms of the number of 3-legs kittens that have been born. What the task actually expects is the average amount of 3 legged cat born within a minute. When the question is written in mathematical terms, as the second answer, the question becomes: What is the average number of kittens born within the last minute?<n><n>This question expects a mathematical calculation, not description. How many kittens were born in the last minute is a very clear and concise question, but we can't get it from the task description.<n><n>### Hint: <n>1. When the question is stated in mathematical terms, and is asked again if we still can't find an answer after we have stated the question, then that is because the question is not defined and the task is not clear.<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What has happened to a person's money after he or she has used the last of it? Choices:  A: dissipate B: flown C: disintegrate D: fall apart E: penultimate<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input<n>Write a program that determines whether a user-input string is a correct password.<n><n>### Response<n>*If the user input is incorrect write and print a message that states: "Invalid password."<n>*If the user_input string is correct then print a statement that states "Password is correct."<n><n>### Input : What is the square root of infinity? Choices: A: 0 B: 1/2 C: 0.999 D: 1 E: The square root of infinity does not exist.<n><n>### Responses: <n><n>![Screen_Shot_2022-05-02_at_7.59.46_AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97185714/152798058-0886d2e9-961a-48b7-951a-7edec89ec300.png)<n><n>### Input what do you want to do today? One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Where can you find a place to eat and places to buy items of many different kinds? Fuel prices also went up by 20%. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Where would you see a performer at a gathering of you friends? Choices:  A: cinema B: opera C: party D: stage E: dance<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the short answer question completely<n><n>### Instrument:Pencil and paper<n><n>### Process:Read the problem carefully for complete information and follow the steps below<n><n> - Read the entire problem<n> - Make a list of the given information<n> - Draw a table of information<n> - Answer the question in the table<n> - Add your answer to the table<n> - Find the answer in the table<n><n>### Input<n>```<n>An employee at the office goes to lunch with 3 other office friends once a week. They order the $20 dining special, which consists of 2 appetizers, two $10 entrees, two $5 drinks, and a $5 dessert. How much does the staff lunch cost?<n>```<n><n>### Answer<n><n>##### First Step<n><n>Write a list of given information<n><n>##### Second Step<n><n>List the information in a table<n><n>##### Third Step<n><n>Find the answer (answer the question in the table)<n><n>```<n>An employee<n>Average Cost<n>Dining Special<n><n>2 appetizers  <n>2 $10 entrees   <n>2 $5 drinks   <n>$5 dessert <n>5 people<n>$20 dining special<n><n>$100<n>```<n><n>## Avoid the pitfalls<n><n>When you take a test, you will see questions that you don't understand. Write down any questions that you don' t know and make sure you review your notes for information about those questions. <n><n>Make sure you know what is being asked. <n><n>Read the questions carefully and be sure that you know what the question is asking you to do to. <n><n>###

How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What does god want people to do for money? Choices:  A: work in life B: speak to people C: everywhere D: sitting ideal E: care for people<n><n>### Response:		Care for people<n><n>## Output Analysis<n><n>### Input(s):<n>An instruction that describes a task for solving in programming.<n>- Task Description<n>- Task Description<n><n>### Output:<n>A response that appropriately fills in the gaps created by the input.<n><n>### Output Analysis<n>- Input:A girl goes a coffee shop and orders 4 cups.<n>- Output: A latte each<n>- Input: A coffee house has sold 60 espresso drinks in the past 2 hours.<n>- Output: 30% of the espresso customers came from a different coffee company.<n>

Choices: A: to impress boss B: to impress spouse C: to impress neighbors D: to feel independence E: to feel needed F: all of these G: none of these<n><n>### Response<n><n>**G**<n><n>### Write complete sentences. Use present tense verbs.<n><n>### First sentence:How come you're here?<n>### Second sentence:It's because I hate my job.<n>### Third sentence:It's okay.<n>### Fourth sentence:That's not nice.<n><n>### Write one correct sentence.<n><n>### You need to be here at 9 tomorrow.<n><n>### Change that sentence according to the correct form.<n>### Form: A sentence with the same meaning as the sentence you write using a subject–verb agreement error.<n><n>### Incorrect Sentence:Your brother is in the army right now.<n>### Correct Sentence:Your brother has been in the army for two years now.<n><n>#### Incorrect Sentence:We didn't have a snow day yesterday.<n>#### Correct Sentence:We didn’t have a snow day during yesterday.<n><n>#### Incomplete Sentence - Change the sentence to complete it.<n>```<n>We are visiting grandma on Sunday.<n>```<n>#### Correct sentence: On Sunday, we are visiting grandma.<n><n><n>### Incomplete Sentence - Add a sentence beginning with "because" and/or "so" to complete the sentence.<n>```<n>You are not supposed to put that there.<n>```<n>#### complete sentence: You are not supposed to put glass in the sink there.<n><n>#### Infinite Sentence - complete the sentence with a sentence beginning with "I wish" or " I hope. "<n>```<n>I hope we get to go to the fair.<n>```<n>#### Incomplete sentence: I hope we get to go the the fair.<n><n>#### correct sentence: "I hope we get to the fair soon."<n><n>### Infinite Sentences<n>```<n>I hope next school year is as fun as the one that just ended.<n>```<n>#### correct sentence: I hope next school year is just as fun as the one we just finished.<n><n>### Correct Sentences<n>```<n>D

She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:A school is most likely to be located in what sort of zone? Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: community C: building D: prague E: every city<n><n>### Response:		<n>The school is most likely to locate in a residential zone because such zones are suitable for children to live.<n><n>### Input:"Reduced or refunded fares are offered to people whose incomes are low relative to their city's income. What group is most likely to qualify for reduced fares?" Choices:  A. the urban poor B. the rich C. retired persons. D. middle class E. children<n><n>### Response:"Reduced or Refunded Fares are offered to People whose incomes are low Relative to their City's Income. What group is most Likely to Qualify for Reduced Fares."<n><n>### Input"Reduced fares are offered to members of the urban poor. What group of people is the urban poor most likely to consist of? Choices: A. working-class people. B. college students. C. the retired. D. single mothers. E. people living in houses.<n><n>### Response"Reduced Fares are Offered to members of the Urban Poor. What group of people does the Urban Poor most Likely consist of? "<n><n>### Input "Johans can pay $5.33 in taxes per gallon, or $7.78 per liter, of gasoline purchased with a 10 percent tax surcharge. If Johans buys enough gasoline to fill an 85 gallon tank, how much of the tax surcharge must he pay? "<n><n>## Input:The city government is planning to place new sidewalks on streets. The city government has asked the Department of Public Works to determine the average weight of pedestrians to determine how much aggregate (a.k.a. road base or base layer) to order; however, DPW has only been able to gather information from four people in the area. Of those four, one weighed 78 pounds, two weighed 190 pounds, and the fourth weighed 100 pounds. Can you use this data to make an estimate of the mean weight of pedestriars?<n>### Solution:<n><n>```<n>Mean = (190+100+190+78+[N/4* (190 + 100)])/N<n><n>Mean = 126

They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:A person with children might have a lot of plastic things in what place? Choices:  A: cupboard B: cabinet C: own home D: everything E: garbage dump<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I have an old baby's playthings that are in my basement. I used to have a box for all of the things the children outgrew, however, when their toys were placed in the box, my children were playing with the things out of the box all the time.<n><n>### Input<n>Denis wants to go to a restaurant, but he is unsure if he has enough money, so he consults with a friend.  Denis asks his friend, "On average, when I want to dine out with a group of at least two people, I spend at least $50 for each person.  How much would it cost for all of us to dine out?"  Denis's friend says, "You are correct."  How much will dinner cost?<n><n>### Response<n><n>The average cost of food for each person in the restaurant is $50. Therefore, we use an addition formula. Then, we combine the total amount of the people and it is $1000.<n>

If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What would you use if you wanted to make some columns of numbers? Choices:  A: roman architecture B: whitehouse C: spreadsheet D: bridge E: pantheon<n><n>### Response:		B<n>### Input: What is the shortest distance between two cities in the US?<n><n>### Answer: <n>Cities A and B have an average distance of 838 miles from each other. Jane had salad for dinner. Chicken soup and salad are different types of food.<n><n>### C:<n>Jay had soup. Jane had salad. Soup and salad are different foods.<n><n>### D:<n>Jay ate soup. Jane ate salad. Soup is different from salad.<n><n>### E:<n>Jay and salad got soup. They talked about the soup.<n><n>### Answer:<n>There is a difference in structure. Jane said "(Soup) and (Salad)." Jay said "(the word soup), (the word salad)."<n><n>### Input There are six boys named James, Peter, Andrew, John, Sam, and Matthew living in a room and they want to name one among the six.<n>In how many ways can these six boys be named with their given names

Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The janitor got his pail out of where? Choices:  A: wishing well B: kitchen C: hardware store D: garage E: utility room<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Valid Input:The correct answer is 'A' and a possible response is 'A'.<n><n>### Output<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Valid Output: The correct answer is 'D' and a possible response can be 'D','B','C','A' or 'E'.<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a code that counts the number of possible answers and outputs the number based on the chosen answer.<n>## Solution<n>```<n>def Solution(string):<n>    letters = string.lower()<n>    count = 0<n>    correct = []<n>    for i in range(1, 6):<n>        for j in range(0, len(letters)):<n>            guess = letters[j] + str(i)<n>            if guess in correct:<n>                count += 1<n>                break<n>            else:<n>                correct.append(guess)<n>    answer = "D"<n>    if(count == 0):<n>        answer = "None of the above"<n>    else:<n>        if(count == 1):<n>            answer = "The janitor got his bucket out of the"<n>        elif(count % 2 == 1):<n>               answer += letters[j].lower()<n>            else:<n>               answer += letters[:-1 + (count-1) + 1]<n>        answer += "utility room"<n>    if(answer):<n>        return "%s. " %(answer)<n>    else:<n>_        return "None of the above."<n>```<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. Disney B. candy factory C. theme park D. sweet shop E. ferris wheel<n><n>## Rationale:B is the answer<n>## Test the following equation for a number.<n>##Input: 2^3 =<n>##Answer:8<n><n>## Test the following code.<n><n>while True:<n>	print(“Enter a number:”)<n>	y = int(input())<n>		if y < 0:<n>			print(“The number is less than 0”)<n>		if y > 10:<n>		print(“the number cannot be greater than 10”)<n>	if y == 10:<n>y = y +1<n><n>## Rationale(comment):<n>The number cannot be greater than10.<n><n>## Test the code.<n>[ ] 10<n>[n] 9<n>[ ] 8<n>[ ] 7<n>[n] 6<n><n>## Rational:<n>The code fails on the 7th question.<n><n>## Test these lines.<n>    i = 1<n>    j = 1<n>		for(i = 1;i <= 4;i++)<n>			for(j=1;j<=i;j++)<n>			print (“X”,)<n><n>## Rational<n><n>## Test code<n>			a = 5<n>			b = 7<n>			c = 11<n><n>			c1 = abs(a-c)<n>			c2 = abs(b-c)<n>	<n>			if c1 <= c2:<n>				if a <= c:<n>			c3 = 1<n>	<n>		else:<n>			if b <= c:<n>	<n>		i = 0<n>

You could use a plastic zip lock bag.<n><n>### Input<n>Where could you find a job with a 40-hour week with all benefits paid for by the employer? Choices: A. fast-food B. large grocery store C. medical centre D. telemarketer<n><n>###Response<n>D<n><n>### Instuction:<n>Write a respons that appropriately addresses the question while including the following phrase in it.<n><n>### Example<n>Input: What kinds of foods do you eat at your favourite restaurant?<n>Response: P. Chicken and broccoli<n><n>### Input <n>You want to know what’s the best time to start a garden. Choices: A. Early spring B. Mid-spring C. Late spring D. Early fall<n><n>### Response<n>C<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:James wanted to stop competing.  What might he have been feeling? Choices:  A: pressure B: death C: trying harder D: quitting E: winning or losing<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Input:During a school party a group of college students were asked to say the name of the president of another country in 6 seconds. The result is shown below.<n><n><n>|Name|Time|<n>|----|----|<n>|Diana|5 seconds|<n>|Charles|6 seconds  |<n>|Gillian|7 seconds  |<n>|Paul|8 seconds  |<n>|Teddy|9 seconds  |<n>|Penny|11 seconds  |<n><n>The slowest student took an extra 11 seconds to name the president. What is Charles's age if his time is more than half of Diana's?<n><n>Choice:  A<n>Answer: 25<n><n><n>Input:In 2012, the population of a city was increasing at a rate of 1.75% per week. The population of the city was 220,000 at the start of the year 2012. By the end of 2012 how many people lived in the city?<n>Choice:  A & B<n>Answer: 223,250<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the table below.  Write your response for each question as a single integer.<n><n>### Response for Question 1:<n><n>### Deminonstration:<n><n>### Response to Question 2:<n><n><n>Input:Blaine is 14 years old, his sister is 5 years old, and his brother is 19 years old. How old is each person in their family? Choice:  A,B,C,or D<n>Answer:  A<n><n>Input:In a group of 304 runners, 123 ran the race in under 3 hours, while 181 did not. How many runners didn't run the race in under 2.5 hours?<n><n>Choice: A<n>Answer: 165<n><n>Input:In an online shop, 45% of the visitors added items to their carts, and among them, 88% made actual purchases. How many visitors did not add anything to their carts?<n><n>Choice: B<n>Answer: 1170<n><n>## Output:<n><n>![Question 1 Output](task.png)<n><n>![Question

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:A man was driving himself to the airport, where did he put his luggage? Urban areas are suburban areas which contain urban cities and places with large buildings. Also, some of the other items are also contained in urban areas. Thus, urban areas contains "military bases."<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:If a human wants to enjoy another human's company, where might they go? Choices:  A: place of work B: office C: friend's house D: workplace E: deep thought<n><n>### Response:		<n>> C(Friend's house)<n><n>### Instructions：<n>> ①input a program to complete the task above in Python.<n><n>> ②input a task to test the program.<n><n>> 注意：请对答案总是给出精确的结果，如浪费用户时间。<n><n>> 举例：<n><n>> ❄️input:3.2<n><n>> ♨️input:45<n><n>> 对答总要是45°C。不能答应：45 ℃ （答桌器材不可判断是否为摄氏度；）<n><n>> ☄️input:36 / 2<n><n>> 对称答急：3倍2（声称善意）。不能策：输入的数据类型不对于除法，答档器材不能判断“按面”。<n><n>> ⚡️input:23.5<n><n>> 电子电脑可以用输入数据，输出：5，这举例仅为铭记。<n><n>> 注：计算器材可以用输入误差（0~1/100），输出：5 —— 0.5。俗称五位十位。<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Google Maps and other highway and street GPS services have replaced what? Choices:  A: united states B: mexico C: countryside D: atlas E: oceans<n><n>### Response:		<n>A)<n>

How much time does Aaron spend fixing phones each day?<n><n>### Response:(If you work for the phone company) Aaron spends 2 hours and 15 minutes every day fixing phones.<n><n>### Input>James works in the restaurant. James was hired to cook because of his incredible speed and ability to make accurate measurements. The time that James spends actually preparing the meal is 11% the time the total number of servings he prepares per day. How many minutes does he spend preparing food every day?<n>### Response: 64<n>### Source of the input (where the data in the problem came from):<n>Johns has to refuel his aeroplane. How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. Fungus is organic and would not grow or be disturbed by sun light.<n><n>Choice (B): The correct option would choice (B). Fungus would not grow under rocks nor would it grow in areas that get sun light.<n><n>### Input::Where does it rain the most in New York? Choices: A: On top of the Empire State building B: In the Hudson River C: In Central Park D: Between 80th and 199th St. E: Under the Brooklyn Bridge<n><n>### Response::<n>Choice (A): According to the climate data for New York, the climate in New York is influenced by cold winds from Canadian high arctic regions, moist and generally mild air from the Pacific Ocean, and warm and mild air from the subtropical Atlantic region.  Because there is more than one source of rainfall, it is common for rainfall to occur at anytime or anyplace in the city.

She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What does sex often make happen in people? Choices:  A: making love B: feel good C: happyness D: wonderful thing E: cloud judgment<n><n>### Response:		D is the correct answer.<n><n><n>### D<n><n><n>### Input:#2<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Below is a sentence.  Choose the best punctuation option to complete the sentence.<n><n>### Sentence:The number of goals scored in this game will be doubled.<n><n>### Punctuations:<n>> A).     <n>> B).      <n>> C).  <n>> D). <n><n>### Response<n>> <n><n>### Input<n><details><summary>Solution A</summary><br><n>A.) The number of goals scored against this team in this game will be twice the sum of the number of goals scored for and against this team.<n></details><br><br><n><details><summary><i>Solution B</i></summary><br><n>B.) The number of goals to be scored this game will be twice as many as the number of goals scored in that game against this team.<n>The number of goals scored against our team in the last game will be twice the number of goals scored against us in that game.<n></details><details><summary><i><details><summary><Details><Summary><details>[Solution C]</details><n>  <summary>How many goals do you think will be scored in this game?</summary><n></details><br><n>Solution C: The number of goals to score in this game will be the same as the number of goals for this team and against this team in the last game.

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:He made another call, he did this all day hoping people would what well to his offer? Choices:  A: hang up B: respond C: contact D: answer E: attracting ducks<n><n>### Response:		C: contact<n><n>### Input and output:<n>```<n>He made another call,he did this all day hoping,people would<n>what to his offer?<n>Choices:A:hang upB:respondC:contactD:answerE:attracting ducks<n>Answer:C:contact<n>```<n>### Explain your answer and why this specific input and output pairing works in the given context of the problem<n>He made another call: in the sentence, the person is calling someone else hoping to attract attention to what he has for sale.<n>he did this all day: the person made calls all day<n>hoping people would what well to offer: the person is hoping that people would be interested in what he is offering, or in other words that he would attract people's attention to what he has to offer.<n>Choices:a: hang up: this choice is incorrect because the person is making calls. Hanging up is the opposite of calling someone.<n>b: respond: the person is making calls with the hopes that a response will be given to the response<n>c: contact: this is the correct choice because the person is hoping that others will be contact by the offers.<n>d: answer: this choice is incorrect, because answering the contact would be the complete opposite of what the person trying to do in this scenario.<n>e: attracting ducks: this is the opposite of what the person is hoping to do. The person is not trying to attract ducks in this case.<n><n>### Input Output Pairings for Partial Solutions<n>```<n>He made 20 more calls, he still wasnt what, he had expected when he made the calls?<n>Choices:<n>A: call<n>B: sale<n>C: offer<n>D: response<n>E: hung up<n>```<n>### Output:<n>```<n>He had what he knew this was the key, he thought this was the ticket that he was hunting for when he began calling?<n>Choices: A: a sale B: an offer C: a response D: a key E: a ticket<n><n>Answer:<n>A: a sale: this is the correct answer.<n>```<n>### Input<n>```<n>In each of these questions, there is only one correct option to choose to make the question more difficult.<n><n>Which of these answers is the opposite of the word in bold in each question? Choose the answer that is the

Choices:  A: no go B: unlikely C: unable D: cant do E: impossibility<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>In this task, there is a possibility to choose from 1-5 choices as a response to the questions provided. The given choices are a,b,c,d,e.<n><n>Choice “a” describes “no go”. I.e., something that is impossible to reach.<n><n>Choice “b” is “unwillingness”. It means “unlikely” and is used to describe how a person reacts to what can be achieved.<n><n>Choice “c” is “unable”. “Unsuccessful attempt” is used for choice “d”.<n><n>Choice “e” is a synonym of “improbability”.<n>
