She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:You can hear testimony of how spirituality changes lives when you do what? Choices:  A: go to church B: appear in court C: watch soap operas D: paying attention E: go into court<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option  C<n><n>### Input (Cracking the Coding Interview):<n>Every time you read a file into memory your  program  crashes for no reason. After you fix the problem, you discover that the problem  was  due  to the fact that the file's size was greater than 2GB.  Why did your  program crash?<n><n>Option  D<n><n>### Response (Cracking the coding Interview):<n><n>The 2GB file limit is the cause of the problem. Because  file  size  of  files  for  reading is greater than 2GB, it will create a problem.<n><n><n>### Input<n>Write a program that determines if two arrays that contain only 9's and 0's have the same value. (Don't use string methods just write an array to an array method that compares 2 arrays)<n><n>Option A: You could write a Java program to implement this.<n><n>Option B: You could write one in javascript.<n><n>Option C: You can use a method in PHP to determine if two arrays are equal.<n><n>Option D: You could use the compare method to compare two arrays to see if they are equal in Python!<n><n>### Response<n>Option A<n><n>### Input –  Cracking the coding Interview:<n>Given two strings of length, compare and return the result if the input strings are equal, otherwise the return -1.<n><n>### Response – Cracking the coding interview:<n><n>The compare method compares 2 strings as provided in the book.<n><n><n>## What would you do if you encountered the following?<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### A)<n>Everytime I try to open the editor in my IDE, it crashes. I’m really tempted to give up, but I’m not ready to admit I can’t  program. How do I find the cause for the crash?<n>Answer: <n>B) <n>The most efficient way to add,  subtract,  multiply, and divide arrays consists of the following steps:<n><n><n>1. Copy the array you want to add the items to.<n>2. Pop off the first item of the array.<n>3. Add, subtract, multiply, or divide  the current array,  the new array, and the removed item.

If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What might a kid do with his friend before going to play? Choices:  A: laugh B: sit C: being entertained D: math E: meet<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A: laugh<n><n>### Instructions:<n>```input: What will Ben learn in next term? Choices:  math, reading, painting, drama A: math B: reading C: painting D: drama E: drama<n>``` <n><n>### Response<n>```math```<n><n>### Input<n>```input: What time will the concert start in three hours? Choices: three hours from now, from now, 10:00 p.m., 7:00 p. m. A: three hours from now B: from now C: 10:0: p. m. D: 7:0: p.m. E: 7:00: p.m```<n><n>#### Response<n>```Concert starts at 10:0 ```

How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:A soccer field that is not contained in a building would be where? Choices:  A: playground B: mexico C: town D: outside E: world cup<n><n>### Response:		A: playground B: town C: outside<n><n>### Input(s):Given that a pound, (#), equals 16 ounces, (oz), how many ounces does 2 pounds equal? Choices: .27<n><n>### Response(s):2<n><n>### Input (s):Given that an 8lb(#) bag of dog food is usually $13, how many kilograms does the same bag weigh? Choices:5.3kg<n><n>### Response (s):5.3<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice or True/False question by providing a logical response.<n><n>### Logical Response:<n>**True**<n><n>### Logic:<n>If a question ends in a statement of “would be” which means that the question is speculating on what is supposed to happen. <n><n>### Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Question:If the cost of 6 boxes of stove is $60 and the cost of 6 pairs of shoes is $80, which of the following represents the relationship of stove to shoes:A: greater than<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Answer:B<n><n>### If you use a logical approach in providing your answer, explain why.<n><n>### Using logic, it is not possible that 6 boxes of stoves costs $60 and 6 pairs of shoess costs $80.  Because the stoves must cost more than the shoes it would mean that 6 boxes of Stoves would have a cost of (6*60) =360.00 and 6 pairs would also mean cost $80.00 that would also mean that total cost = 360.01 >80 which would mean that the stove cost more.<n><n>### Answering a True/False question<n><n>True/False<n><n>### If the statement is true the answer is true. If the statement is false the answer is false. If the statement contains a logical error the answer is false.<n><n>### Given an accounting software question, a logical answer would be:<n><n>### A: greater than<n><n>In the first question, the word “greater than” means that the stove is more expensive than the shoes

They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:They moved out of the city to have a master bedroom, what kind of home did they seek? Choices:  A: large house B: suburban home C: big house D: old house E: keeping personal objects<n><n>### Response:		<n>Larger living space <n><n><n>### Input 2: How quickly can the workers complete ten holes in the wallpaper? Choices A: four minutes B: eight minutes C: sixteen minutes D: eleven minutes E: twelve minutes<n><n>### Response<n>Eleven minutes   <n><n><n>### Instructions 3:<n>Which of the following statements is the best way to help save the environment? Choose the best answer(s).<n><n>### Choice A: If everyone recycles, that will help the environment. <n>### Choice B: We need to stop using fossil fuels that harm the environment.<n>### Choice C: Planting a few trees in your front yard is a small step.<n>### Choose the best answer to the problem.<n><n><n>### Choose A, if you believe that everyone should carry a plastic bag in their pocket to avoid using plastic bags. <n>### No matter how expensive plastic bags are, you should buy them because they are still better for the environment than paper bags. <n><n>### Choosse B, if you think that it will be a good idea to get a bag that can be a pocket and is made from paper, if you buy things in a supermarket often. <n>### If you think, if you buy things more than 10 times a month, you should start carrying a reusable and washable bag because the environmental impact would be bigger.<n><n>### Choosen C, if you think that the best way to help the environment is not to use bags, paper or plastic, at all.  Plastic bags are bad for the environment.  There are reusable, washable and durable bags, but they are costly.<n><n><n>## Instructions 4: <n>We will give you a question about the weather, a choice of possible answers to that question, and four possible reasons (one from each choice) why someone might use that answer. Choices:  A: weak B: fragile C: forceless D: regular E: flimsy<n><n>### Response:		<n>Glass isn't strong because it has a thin layer of glass protecting the core on the outside.  The glass around the core is called the glass itself because it contains the core of glass.  Glass is weak because the outside layer of glass is thin.  That means it breaks easily which causes the core to be exposed to the outside world.  That also means that this type of glass cannot contain itself.<n><n>### Input::Glass that hasn's been treated to be extra is what? Choices A: weak B: durable C: strong D: fragile E: forceless<n><n>### Response<n>Glass isn's strong because it has a very clear and thin layer of glass protect around the core.  That means the outside layer of glass isn't as strong.  It's known that glass is made of different ingredients, such as sand, lithium, fluorine, and titanium dioxide.  These ingredients are combined together through a complex procedure.  There're different kinds of glasses that have different purposes in use.  The most popular type is known as the "clear glass".  This is used in windows, lamps, and other items.<n><n>### What are the two words that the author uses in her introduction that are similar to each other?<n><n>### Demo:<n>**Answer:**<n><n>### What is the meaning of her writing "and also"?<n><n>### Demo<n><n>### What does the term "core" mean in the second sentence?<n><n>### demo<n><n><n>### The word "exposed" is used to mean which of the following? He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What has a master of their craft done about that craft? How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:He was a very sharp engineer, but when it came to the details his calculations could were often what? Choices:  A: complimentary B: inelegant C: ocean D: dull E: inaccurate<n><n>### Response:		<n>"B." - Incorrect, "C"<n><n>### Input:"Jade and Josh ate 200 pastries and cakes from the new bakery.  Each pastries cost \$50. How much did I spend the day before I got my paycheck?"<n><n>### Response:"I spent \$10000"<n><n>### Question:"How much is a box of 100 gummy candies worth?"<n><n>### Answer:"$400"<n><n><n>### Input":"Karen has a dog, a cat, and a hamster.   <n>A dog can eat $5 of dog food a week.   <n>A cat can eat $25 of cat food in a week.   <n>It costs \$50 per month to keep the hamster.   <n>How much does it cost a week to take care of the pets?"<n><n>### Analysis:"$75" - First find average cost of all pets.  \$5500 \div 5 = \$1100.  \$1100 \div 7 = \$167.50.  Now find percent of amount eaten to that amount. <n><n>### Input:\$5809.   - First find average cost for one month.   \$5809 \div 12 = \$484.\$  Subtract $484 from overall number and divide remaining by number of months.<n><n>### Response:\$492<n><n>### Input \& Response:<n>```<n>Question: How much does it cost to take care of 7 pets in 2 months?<n><n>Answer: "$1512"<n><n>```<n><n>### Instructon:<n>1. Find the average cost for all the pets in each month.<n>2. Find the number of pets each month.<n>3. Take the number of pets in each month times the cost of pet in that month.<n>4. Add up all the totals.<n>5. Divide the answer by the number of months.<n>For example.<n>```<n>Question: What is the amount of groceries that Amanda uses in 5 weeks?<n><n>Answer: 2<n>```<n><n>## Instruction:<n><n>1. Find the total amount of money Amanda has.<n>2

Since you are a person, you have the ability to speak a language other than English.<n><n>### Input If I am a person, I have a unique ability?<n><n>### Response<n><n>| Name | Student | Answer |<n>| ---- | ------- | ------ |<n><n>### Instructions You are provided with three data tables. Choices:  A: country club B: rich person's house C: pool D: park E: fitness center<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>###<n><n>### Inputs<n>`{<n>"input":[<n>  {<n>    "type":"text",<n>    "value":"He waited for his friend",<n>    "id":"text-0-0-0",<n>    "key":"text-0-line-0-0",//lines<n>    "end":"\n",<n>    "indent":"0"<n>  },<n>  {<n>	  "type":"text",//type:text of the question<n>	  "value":"but he was worried his",//the questions<n>	  "id":"text-1-0-0",	//the first text of the question<n>	"indent":"0"<n>}<n>],<n>"out":[<n>    {<n>	    "line":"0",//lines<n>	    "_text":"",<n>        "type":"answer",<n>        "value":"He was worried his",<n>        "id":"ans-0-0-",<n>        "key":"ans-0-line-",<n>        "context":"",<n>	    "contextId":"ans-0-",<n>	    "indentation":"      ",//indent the ans<n>        "answerType":"text",//text<n>	    "answers":[<n>	        {<n>	            "score":0,//0-100<n>   					//the score of the ans<n>				"text":"",//answers<n>				  "type":"answer",//A: answer<n>					  "_text":"",<n>				        "id":"answers-0-0-3-0-0", //<n>	        	"key":"answers-0",//answers-0, the key of the ans0<n>				      "context":"",<n>    				      //the context of the ans<n>	    			      "key": "answers-0-line-"<n>    			<n>  				}<n>	    ]<n>       }<n>]}<n><n>### Output<n>`{<n>"out":[      {<n>	    "type":"answer", //type of answer<n>   	  "value":"He was", //the ans<n>	  "id": "answer-0-0-line-2",<n>		"key

How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The camper looked up at the vast night sky, it left him feeling mighty what? Choices:  A: boredom B: patience C: time D: teachers E: inspiration<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choice B<n><n>### Support:<n>The job of being a teacher is to convey knowledge to students.  Teachers can do this best by creating patience and boredom. The more patience they have, the less they will be distracted. This leads to less boredom, and the teacher can concentrate on the task of transferring knowledge. Teachers need to have a great deal of patients because they deal with students who often lack it. Teachers do not know what is going on in their classroom. They need to be patient enough to wait to see if they can help a struggling student, or if the student is disinterested and disengaged from the lessons.<n><n>### Feedback:<n>Good job on your response!  You used the prompt as the basis for your answer, and you used words like: "need", "great," "attending", "what would teacher",  and "less" as conjunctions.  You also used a great deal in your response.<n><n>### Input<n>To properly instruct a child in school to do a math problem you would need what of the answers choices?<n><n>### Response<n>Time<n><n>### Support<n>Being able to do math is an important part of being a student. If you spend the time, you can learn math.<n><n>### Answer<n>Time is the right answer to this prompt.<n><n>## AI_MultipleChoices_N1<n>* *Write your name here:*  <n>* *This program works out an equation for finding the volume of each of a set of three cylindrical boxes. How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. Choices:  A: pay debts B: make money C: having money D: making money E: keep house<n><n>### Response:		(A)<n><n>### Input<n><n><n>### Demand:Elsa bought a gallon of milk and a quart of milk.  The quart he bought cost the same as 4 quarts of milk.  How many gallons of milk?<n>### Response:<n>The quart bottle and the gallon bought together are 5 times the quart, so the quart bottle is 1/5 (or 20%) of the gallon.<n><n>So to calculate total gallons bought, we get $16 for one quart of milk, and one quart is 1/5th of one gallon... Therefore we multiply that by 5 (the number of quarts in a gallon), and get $16 * 5 = $80.<n><n>### Input:(Two different questions are to be written to test two different things)<n>A: You have a 20 pack of canned beverages at home.  For breakfast, you usually drink 2 cans of the beverage.  How many of the pack are necessary to last 6 weeks of breakfast, as you usually buy new pack the following week?<n>### Response:(2nd question)<n>You're basically describing how they make 6-packs, of 2-cans in each pack, of that beverage. You have 20 packs, so you need to divide them into 2 to get 5 sets of 2-pack (1 pack of 2 = 14). Then you need to get a 2-1 formula to get you 2 packs per week. Then you plug it in to get you 10 weeks. You're 1 pack short, so you'll need the 11th pack of the 20 you have left.<n><n>A: You have 2000 pieces of a certain shape and color and another 2000 of a different shape and color. How many are black in total?<n>### Response<n>You start by saying, what fraction of the total is black, in the first set. (We won't go into the why you would need to know this, but it boils down to being able to do the division in your head later). After doing this, you need to add in the fraction of the other shape + the fraction of the black color. The total number of pieces won't match the

Choices:  A: neighbor's house B: bridge C: home D: homeless shelter E: prison<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Comment:<n>E<n><n>### Solution:<n>A, D<n><n>### Explanation:<n>In the instruction, we are told Jimmy wants to find a place that sells alcohol legally. This can not be a house that holds alcohol as his wife has been put on probation. As a consequence, one of the possibilities is in a homeless shelter. However, Jimmy is looking to purchase alcohol. A homeless shelter will not provide alcohol.<n><n>Therefore, either Jimmy will find a homeless person outside and purchase alcohol from them or he will go to a home that sells alcohol, which may be a liquor store or a home.<n><n>### Solution Code:<n>{% highlight python %}<n><n>{% if solution %}<n>    A<n>{% else %}<n>    D<n>{% endif %}<n><n>{% endhighlight %}<n>

Choices:  A: botanical garden B: doctor's office C: in a sea D: public place E: arboretum<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is A, Botanical Garden. The question is "Where would a _special_ ficus be found." The choice is alliterative, and the word "special" implies that the ficus of choice is unique compared to other usual instances of ficus. (You could also make an argument that the answer should be E, the Arboretum, since it is the answer in the question. But the answer is still B, since it is alliterative.) B, Doctor's Office, might make sense if a botanical garden were a place that only held very old specimens with no new plants coming in. That's less likely though.<n><n>### Input<n>The answer is C, "in a sea." The choice is allosematic, and the word "in" in the choice implies that the object of study would be in the sea, as opposed to in a "sea" (i.e being surrounded by water). <n>### Response<n><n>### Input & task<n>Your job is to complete the code based on the following question and instructions:<n><n>Input: A person has 174 lizards, and sells 1/7 of them. How many fewer lizards does he bring back to town than when he left?<n><n>### My solution<n><n>### Solution<n>

Choices:  A: copy B: intelligent C: improved performance D: empowering E: have more knowledge<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>> E<n><n>### Your turn:<n><n>```javascript<n>var question;<n>var numberOfOptions = 5;<n>question = ["C:", "D:", "E:", "A:", "B:"];<n><n>function processQuestion(question) {  <n>    printLog(question);<n>    writeOption();<n>    var guesses = 4;<n><n>    if (question.length === 0) {<n>        writeOutput(guesses, " ");<n>    }<n><n>    if (guesses > question.length) {<n>        writeInput(question.slice(0,guesses));<n>        writeAnswer(question);<n>        count++;<n>    }<n><n><n>    function writeOption() {<n>        for (var i = 0; i < numberOfOptions; i++) {<n>            if (question === answerOption[i]) {<n>                writeOptionOutput(i);<n>                break;<n>            }<n>        }<n>    }<n>    function writeOptionOutput(index) {<n>        writeOptionInput(index);<n>        writeOptionOutput(writeOptionOut.concat([index], writeOptionOut.length));<n>    }<n>    //printLog(question);<n><n><n><n>    function printLog(question){<n>        console.log(question);<n>    }<n>    console.log('-=-=-');<n>    function writeInput(question) {<n>        for (i = 0; i <= numberOfOptions; i++){<n>            writeInputOption(i, question);<n>            writeOutput(' ');<n>        }<n>        writeOutput(' ');}<n><n>    function writeInputOption(index, question){<n>        writeInputOption(writeInput.concat(question),'C');<n>        writeInput('D');<n>        writeInputOption('E','A');<n>        writeInput();<n>        writeInput(' ');}<n>    function writeInputOut(){<n>        console.log('-=---===?');}<n><n>    function printOutput(){<n>        console.table(answerIndex.toString());<n>    }<n>    }<n><n>const questions = [];<n>//questions.push("What do you need to do to learn hard concepts? A: Copy them B: Improve performance C: have knowledge D: Have intelligence E: Empower yourself");<n>console.log("Enter questions? ");<n>for (let i = 0;

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What do rich people like in terms of bagels? Choices:  A: poor B: sleepy C: plain D: needy E: homeless<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>In general, rich people like bagels that are poor, sleepy, plain, or needy. <n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple answer questions.<n><n>### Response 1:<n>Adam pays $800 in taxes ($12/kg * 3 * $8/kg)<n>### Response 2:<n>James's fuel costs $484 ($200 * $2 * 20%)<n>### Response 3:<n>Tom drinks 3660 ounces of fluid a week ($5 * 12 * 7 * 21).<n>### Response 4:<n>Two people fill 26070 cubes in 6 hours, 300 boxes contain 3600 cubes, so each box contains 12 cubes.<n>### Response 5:<n>4900 widgets get shipped<n>### Response 6:<n>770 $ for overtime + weekly salary<n>### Response 7:<n>"Moneybunny" is a poor, sleepy, needy, plain bagel.<n>### Instruments: <n><n>### Clockface<n><n>## Contributions<n><n>-   [@rishi](https://github.com/rishi): created the issue.  <n>

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The cow would come outside even after the storm had passed, it wouldn't leave the what? How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:How does a flea locomote? Joe was the opposite.  What was Joe, regarding that decision? Choices:  A: being for B: away from C: combined D: for or E: conjunction<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple selection question.<n><n>## The "Answer the question" type<n><n><n>The "Answer the question" task type is similar for both students and teachers; therefore, this topic focuses on how to administer this task type and evaluate the students responses. <n><n><n>### Instructions:Provide the correct answers to the following questions.<n><n>Q: If `x^2 = 4` then `x =?`<n><n>A: 2<n><n>Q: Choose the term of the following sequence:<n><n>|-2, -3, -4, -5,...|-1, 1, 2, 3,...|<n><n>A: -3<n><n>### Instructor Feedback:<n>Teachers can provide the expected response formats for the students. The feedback can identify the appropriate format for students who provide responses in various ways.<n><n>## Preview the Answer<n><n>We can enable preview for the students to see the answer before submitting the answer. This feature is only available for Microsoft Teams users.<n><n><n>## Preview Answer<n><n>Preview Answer allows students to review answers to the question before submitting their answer. This setting is supported only in Microsoft Teams.<n><n>In Microsoft Teams, Preview Answer is enabled by default. If enabled for the LTI tool in Teams, there is no need for a configuration to enable this setting in Teams. However, we highly recommend checking the LTI tool to ensure that Preview Answer is enabled.<n><n><n>### Preview Response 1<n><n>The students can preview the answer before submitting it in Microsoft Teams:<n><n>1. From the Microsoft Teams course page, click Content.  On the **Teacher** tab, in the **Tools** section, click LTI.<n><n>2. (Optional) If you're using a new LTI integration, click **Create Integration**.<n><n>3. In the list of Microsoft Teams learning tools, find the tool you want to preview.<n><n>4. In the panel, next to Preview answers before submitting, enter a value.<n><n>    > [!div class="mx-imgBorder"]<n>    >![Microsoft Teams preview response](../_img/classroom-previewresponse-mt.png)<n><n>### Previous Response 2<n><n>If Preview Answer is disabled in Microsoft Teams, the students have no

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. Choices:  A: town B: carpeting C: city D: phone book E: magazines<n><n>### Response:		I would definitely go to the bookstore which is a kind seller of books. There are many kinds of books in store such as novels, historical, and children’s books. Furthermore, they provide the discounts for students, military members, and more. We can go through the Internet and choose the books we want by clicking the links to buy online. However, there are more interesting books in the bookshop. Lastly, in the summer time there is special event in which we can get 2 books with only on dollar.<n><n>### Input :What should you say to someone who speaks slowly? Choices:  Excuse me sir, can you _________? A: move faster B: hurry up C: go home D: talk faster<n><n>### Response : Since we all are in the same class, I'll give you advice. I can't imagine someone who speaks slowly. Maybe the person can speak slowly due to his or her condition such as illness, or he or she has too little experiences. When you want to speak to the person, you can say, "Please speak more slower. I couldn't understand what you said." or "Please slow down".<n><n>### Input How long does it take to fly from New York to San Francisco? __________. A: 4 hours B: 44 hours C: 48 hours D: 45 hours<n><n>### Response New York to San Francisco is 3130 miles. So if we take a plane, it will take 5.25 hours to fly from New York. Hence, it will take less than 5 hours.<n><n>### In the next 10 years, the average life expectancy for humans will _________. A: get shorter B: get longer C: stay the same D: become unpredictable<n><n>### Response In the past, people who were born in earlier time they have a little longer days. Today, if we have good health conditions such as healthy eating, enough sleep and work out, our bodies will be healthy. However, it can't be for all cases. If we have different illness, we may live for shorter days. <n>

They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Which effect of stress could cause death if not treated immediately? Choices:  A: age grieving person B: heart attacks C: depression D: hair loss E: headache<n><n>### Response:

He ate them both at the same time. B. He ate one sandwich and threw the other away. C. He tried both but threw both away.<n><n>### Response:"He tried both but threw both of them away."<n><n>### Input:'Pear is bigger than apricot.' Choices: A: both are true and false B: both are true but not false C: both are false but true D: True<n><n>### Response:'Pear is bigger but apricot is smaller'<n><n>### Input:{ 1: {number: 10, type: 'even', color: 'black'},<n> 2: {type: 'odd'}} Choices: A: {number_type: 'color' }<n><n>### Response:{number_type:{number: 10 color: 'black' }}<n><n>### Input {'name': 'Melanie', 'date': {year: 2019, month: 'dec', 'day': 12}} Choices: A. You have been researching the park and have decided on two of the sights: Mount Rainer and Crater Lake. The drive takes 2.5 hours without stopping (the roads are well maintained) and 3.5 hours with stops at the restaurants along the way.  If you have 10 hours to visit the two parks how long can you spend at each place?<n><n>### Demosition:<n>S1: You want to visit Mount Rainer for at least 4 hours and Crater Lake for at least 5 hours.  You should depart no sooner than 7 AM to give yourself adequate time to visit each park. How late can you return without stopping on the way home?<n>S2: It takes you an hour to drive home. You also spend 20 minutes packing up and loading up the car for departure. The drive home is an hour. When you get home, it takes you 20 minutes to unload and put away the luggage.  Let x = the time at home. How much time do you have left after you finish driving home?<n><n>### Instrection:<n>John is going to make waffles for his family.  He will use the whole packet of blueberries and half of the packet of strawberries. If he needs 1.5 packets of milk, how much milk should he buy?<n><n>### Explanation:<n>S1: In general, the ratio between blueberries and strawberries will be (b/m) = the ratio of units of blueberries to units of strawberries (b/s).   In our example, these will be 1/2.  So, to find the ratio of strawberries:<n>(s/2)/b = (s/2)/b  S1: s/2 - b/2<n><n>S2: We want to make sure that the ratio of strawberry:milk = 1.5 and that John can get the needed amount of milk for the blueberries and stawberries.  If the ratio of strawbergries to milk is 1.5, then we get:<n>      (s/1.5)/b = (s

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:After new coke was discontinued what formula was used? Choices:  A: original B: old C: coke clear D: former E: familiar<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions: You got to work.  A customer ordered 3 sandwiches (each costs $10), 1 salad (costs, $18), and one drink (costs, $2). What is the total cost of the customer’s order?<n><n>### Instructor: Adam went to the bank yesterday and was able to withdraw 1/4 of the amount he wanted to from his savings account, but then he immediately deposited half of the rest after withdrawing it. The men in the group caught 2 kilograms and the women in the group caught 3 kilograms.<n><n>### Response<n>16*3-16*2<n><n>### Instructions:What is the value of w x y in the following set of numbers? x=2 y = w x y = 2 - 3 + 1 + 2 -25 x=2 y = 20 w ( 2 x 20) = 40<n><n>### Response:(20-2)*2<n><n>### Task:  Input:  A group of people went to a fast food place where the standard price of food is $3. How many pizza crusts were thrown away for one of them to get a pizza?<n><n>### Input:(60*10)/6<n><n>### Task 2: The price of a shirt includes an additional 5% tax on the selling price of $30. How much does each person pay for the shirts?<n><n>### Response :<n>1(30-5)+(30-5) + (30-5)<n><n>### Task<n>How many people will it take to finish a job that John, Peter, and Sarah can finish in 9 days working alone?<n>Ans: 3/2<n><n>### Response to Task :<n>800*3/2<n><n>

Click on a language at the top to see something written in your own language.<n><n># TASK 2<n><n>You will find a prompt and some instructions for submitting your work for a project, such as this one.<n><n>### Prompt<n><n>In this assignment, you will choose an app and describe its UX (user experience), UI (user interface), and a UX approach. You will be assessed on your ability to identify the following aspects of an app:<n><n>* User needs<n>* Content and layout<n>* Navigation<n>* Visual design<n>* Tasks<n>* Icons and images<n><n>### Instructor feedback:<n><n>* Apps should be designed for the intended audience.<n>* Designers should use user testing to refine designs.<n>* Navigation should not lead users down dead ends.<n>* Icons should be consistent and clear.<n>* Colors should not cause fatigue or annoy users.<n>* Content: text, audio and video.<n>* Content hierarchy and layout.<n>* Tasks and actions, which should be obvious, as well as clear instructions.<n>* Visual design, i.e., buttons, labels, icons, font, images.<n>* Design for multiple devices<n>* Design should be focused on the user’s needs, not on designer preferences.<n><n>### Submit your Response:<n><n>Select the Assignment,

Fuel prices also went up by 20%. Choices:  A: villa B: spacecraft C: hall D: palace E: hotel<n><n>### Response:		hall<n><n>### Input (with errors/fix the errors):A: villa<n><n>### Answer:hall<n><n>### Input<n><n>In a game of chess, a player's move only occurs when (at the end of) their turn is fully ended as in there is no more turns for the other player to play (that is, when all available moves have been finished).<n><n>### Response<n><n>In a game chess, a player moves the king or queen on its turn. This means that if during the game at least one of them hasn't moved once, then the player would have no move in the final turn of their opponent.<n><n>### Response (2):<n>A player's move consists of moving a piece on the chessboard. In a game of chess this means moving the king or queen. The king or queen move by being the target of one of your opponent moves and also must always be your final move.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>The reason that it is not possible for a player not to have a move in the final turn is because the king and queen move once in each move and therefore cannot be part of any other player's move.<n><n>## Task:Input-Write an instruction: "In a game of chest, a player's moves only happen when a move ends."Response-Write a response for the given input: "In a game chest, a player moves the King or Queen on his turn."Response (2)-Write "A player's move comprises of moving a piece on a chest-board. In a game chest, this means moving the king and the queen."Answer-Write the answer.<n><n>## Reference:https://www.udemy.com/course/write-code-like-a-pro-programming-skills-training/?autocoverbar=0#<n>

Your objective is to identify a subset of flights that include all the flights in one of the schedules. Use the subset to schedule an optimal number of flights in a different schedule (given capacity). How can you do this?<n><n>### Demostrate<n><n>Input: There are 30 flights in the following schedule:<n><n>1 17:10:58 16:20:44<n><n>2 15:40:28 14:09:39<n><n>3 15:25:11 14:25:59<n><n>4 15:00:48 13:59:53<n><n>5 17:09:40 13:35:59<n>Input: All of the flights are scheduled in this schedule.<n>Input: There are also 20 flights in the flight schedule below:<n><n>1 22:24:05 21:30:06<n><n>2 17:26:56 16:42:01<n><n>3 17:03:24 15:31:14<n><n>4 16:28:35 15:20:08<n><n>5 21:24:37 13:57:00<n><n>Input The 30 flights that belong to schedule 1 should be scheduled in schedule 2, however the 20 flights that are also a part of schedule 2 can be scheduled anywhere there is a slot.<n><n>### Response<n>Answer: All of the fligh that are in the schedule above should be scheduled at the same time for the flights above.<n><n>### Input<n><n>There are 30 fligh that belong to schedule 2 and 20 flighs they can be scheduled at any time<n><n>### Output<n><n>The 20 flights can be scheduled at the same times as the flights in the schedule above.<n><n>## Instruction<n><n>The first step

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What is illegal to do when you play cards at a casino? Choices:  A: remember B: help C: count D: winning E: dealing<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Input:If you make a hand that scores more than 20 points in one turn with Scrabble game, what will it be called?<n>Answer:<n><n>### Comment:I guessed the correct answer
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:At a state fair judging pigs requires careful what? Choices:  A: verdict B: judging C: responsibility D: evaluating E: prejudice<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the question is asking for the _best_ response, then A is the best. "At a state fair" implies in a contest. The contest would require careful judging rather than careless. "Judging pigs requires careful judgment." _Duty_ might work as well.<n><n>### Input : How many states are on the eastern seaboard? Choices: 12 1 3 38 8<n><n>### Response :<n>7 states are on the east coast! Choice 1 is not the best because of it's wording. "The east coast" generally is referring to the northeastern part of the coastline of the United States. There is actually a west coast. Choice 2 is not the correct answer because it lists 1. New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Tennessee and Texas. I'm not sure how New Jersey is a state on the east seaboard. I'm not positive but perhaps the answerer is referencing the "Jersey shore" which could be listed separately if you mean the state. Choice 3 is not the correct answer choice because it is referencing a 4th of July celebration and not the number of states.<n><n>### input:If 20% of 46.8 million equals five-hundred and twenty-five thousand, what is 52.6 million?  Choice: 58.3 million 48 million 4.8 million 0.48 million 0.2 3.2 million 0.2 is the best choice because the question is asking for a _division_ rather than multiplication. The question asks for 20% which should be the answer.<n><n>### Comment: ANSWERED<n><n>### input : What does the number of 26 represent? Choices: 25 two-fifths 18 44 90 568<n><n>### Comment : ANSWERED

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The lady was doing a one man show of her tell story, when the show began she did what? Choices:  A: persuade B: slept C: take center stage D: challenge E: speak clearly<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Solution<n><n>**Input:** The man who took credit for your invention was your professor and he asked you to show him how it works.<n>**Response:** D<n><n>### Input<n><n>**Input: A** Every day Tom drinks five 12 oz cans of soda, plus 64 oz of water. How many oz of fluid does he drink in a week?<n>**Response A**: He drinks 868<n>**Response B**: 668<n>**Response C**: 2240<n>**Response D:** 1564<n>**Response E:** 1088<n><n>### Input(Explanation)<n><n>Suppose Tom drinks 5 cans of soda which is 10 oz each and 64 oz water everyday in a week, The total drink in a week is 76 oz, and then he drink 80 oz per day.<n><n>The answer can be obtained from this:<n>**5 (10 oz)+64 (80oz)+32 (240 oz)**<n>```<n>Total = 76<n>```<n>```<n>We have to use this logic to solve this question.<n>```<n><n>### Input (Explanation)<n>**Input:** A truck can hold 6000 stones. Stella and Twinkles fill the truck with 250 stones per hour each so they can fill it up in 4 hours and they are joined by 6 other workers who also work at the rate of 6 per hour which takes just 6 hours to fill. How many hours did it take to fill the truck?<n><n>**Response A:** 13<n>**Response B:** Can't think of any<n>**Response C:** Can't figure it out<n>**Response D: 10<n>**Response E: 6<n><n>### Input and Answer<n>**Input:** 5 (8 x 16)<n>**Response:** 112<n>**Correct:** 5(16)<n><n>### Input 100 (105)<n>**Initial Input:** 101<n>**Response:** A<n>```<n>101<n>```<n>```<n>100

The question should have only single option answer.<n><n>## Constraints:<n><n>- 1 line response for each instruction.<n>- Use the format specified in the request, using the sample below: [Instruction: Answer the following multiple-choice questions.]<n>

How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The college kids weren't known for their apartment decor choices, they used a folding chair inside their what? Choices:  A: bathroom B: closet C: school D: room E: church<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### The correct answer is (A) Bathroom<n>### Explanation:<n>I knew that the answer was either A or D but I went with my feeling and chose the one that was more interesting. In this case it was D. Since I'm not sure which is the correct answer I have chosen none of the above because I am confident that the correct answer is either (A) bathroom or (D) closet.<n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What could you put a table in if you want the table to be in your house? Choices:  A: library B: demonstration C: corner D: football ground E: rug<n><n>### Response:		E: rug<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>> A: library<n>> B: demonstration<n>> C: corner<n>> D: football ground<n>> E: rug<n><n><n>### Explanation<n><n>The answer will be in the last case<n><n>### Demo<n><n>```python<n>>>> answer = ['library', 'corner', 'football ground', 'rug']<n>>>> answers = input("What could you put a 4 in your house?")<n>>>> for x in answers:<n>...   answer.remove(x)<n>...<n>...  input("")<n>>>> print(answer[-1])<n>E: rug<n>```<n><n>### Exercise<n><n>- Exercise 1.<n>> What could you put a 1 in your house?<n><n>- Exercice 2.<n>> What could put a 3 in your house?<n>

Choices: A: Nicaragua B: El Salvador C: Belize D: Cuba E: Mexico<n><n>### Response<n><n>A<n><n>#### # of Correct Answers: 28/28<n><n>#### # of Totally Wrong: 0/28<n><n>```<n># 39_Codes<n>=======<n>0=a<n>1=b<n>2=c<n>3=d<n>4=e<n>5=f<n>6=g<n>7=h<n><n># 40_Pick_a_Number<n>=======<n>0 to 5 are options<n>```<n>

If they can't do this, other choices will become harder to make.<n><n>### Input<n>> Write a program to solve this puzzle<n>><n>> You need to find all solutions by following instruction (0, 1,..., N)<n>><n>> 1) When one row of 8 spaces reachable by path is empty<n>> 2) When another row of 8 spaces unreachable<n>> 3) When the grid is empty<n>> 4) Every solution requires all rows and columns are filled<n><n>### Response<n>0, 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 72, 80<n><n># 문제 상태입니다. : 요령 다시 쓰고 토요일 다시 돌기<n><n># 문재석 2.0 개발<n><n>## 프로젝트 리뷰 : 정답 피드백<n><n>### 문제 1 : 무조건 3<n><n>답방 구매 기준 : <n>- 가격에 따름 <n>- 판매자 순 <n>- 감독 순 이 주의 자리 값 끼어도 됨<n><n>### 무조걸 4<n><n>이번 문제가 해를 시키는 것! 지금 처리하는 방법도 모르게요. 노트 까먹네요.<n>문제를 자세히 피드바크 주는 저 씨 같이 해야겠습니다.<n><n>## 자동된 발견

If the 500 marble are split evenly between the two bags, approximately how many marbles will be in each bag?<n><n>### Response:(Math) Divide the number of marbles in one bag among the number of marbles divided from one bag to the other: 500/2 = 250<n>Notice that 250 is the same amount as the amount of marbles that are in one bag (250) and amount separated between two bags is (500-250)=250<n>### Input:The number of goals scored by two soccer players last season accounts for exactly 40% of all goals the league. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What is a place that could have tens of thousands of fiddle? Choices:  A: tennessee B: band practice C: orchestra D: violin case E: music store<n><n>### Response:		A. Tennessee has many fiddlers. <n><n>### Instructions:Use the drop-down or radio button to select the response that correctly completes each instruction.<n><n>### Response1: A. There is a violin case for every player here. <n><n>## Instructions: Choose the response that correctly completing the instruction given.<n><n>### Input 1: 14<n><n>### Input2: What is the square root of the reciprocal of 39?<n><n>### Response2: 6<n><n>### Response3: 28<n><n>### Instruct:The number is less than half of 3,000. What is the number?<n><n>### Input4: 548<n><n>### Input5: Which of the following expressions is equal to 52?<n><n>```<n>    x+2 x-3 or<n>    x-2 x+3 or<n>    x2-3 x+2<n>    x-2+3  x-3<n>```<n><n>### Response5: x-2+3<n><n>### Instinct:Use mathmatics to add the second term of the sequence to find the third and fourth terms. The numbers of the sequence are 41, 61, and 81.

In the wilderness, they lit up what? Choices:  A: outer space B: night sky C: universe D: orbit E: the ground<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>`james loved the stars` <n>`what`<n>`lights up`:<n>\begin{itemize}<n>\item night sky<n>\item universe<n>\item orbit <n>\item the ground <n>\item outer space<n>\item stars<n>\end{itemize}<n><n>`up what?`:<n>\begin{enumerate}<n>\item orbit<n>\item the ground<n>.night sky<n>\item universe <n>.stars<n>\end{enumerate}<n>`UP what  `<n>Answer: night sky<n><n>`lights up what?`<n>\begin{enumerate}[(1)]<n>\item night sky (up the night sky,  ) <n>\item universe    (stars have a place in the universe) <n>\item Ground      (stars light up the ground)  <n>\item Orbit       (stars light up orbit of planets)     <n>\end{enumerate}\item stars        (stars light up space)<n><n>`What lights up what? (or) what do stars light up?  `<n>`stars light up`.<n>### What do stars light up?<n><n>\begin{code}<n>james loved the stars <n>in the wilderness,they lit up? <n>lights   <n>stars    <n>\end{code}<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response to the question in this box: A wizard went to the store and bought a box of 50 hats. These cubicles do not come cheap at $250/cubicle. One cubicle is $250, $250+$250 etc...). If a new employee is hired to fill an empty cubicle, what is the cost of filling in every cubicle in the building with employees?<n><n>### Response:(This is a math answer:) It would cost up to 50$ for each cubicle.<n><n>The cost for each cubicle would be 250$ for all the cubicles that already had 1 person in them, and 100$ for each of the cubicles with only 59 employees in it.<n>

The person must be fit and preferably a woman to lift the bags and a car must be provided. What amount must you pay as hiring charge?<n>Answer: 250/day<n><n>### Response<n>You are hiring a person to move 40kg bags on a 2 week contract. The person has to be fit and preferably female. The job requires them to lift the bags which weigh 20kg so the employee must be fit. The employee must also be provided with a car which costs 12000. The employee must then be paid a fee of 400 for each 40 kg bag moved so the amount that you must spend is (20 x 20 + 400 x 40 / 100) = 800 x 4 =?.<n><n>### Input.<n><n>Input: A person is required to load a truck with 800kg of stone. The truck has a capacity of 6200kg, how many trips does the person need to take to fill the truck?<n>Answer : 14<n>### Response<n>This person is required to load 800kgs of stone but the truck has a capacity. To make the numbers work the person is required to make 14 trips as each trip requires the person to lift 800kg so 14 x 800 = 11200 / 6200. 1120/2 = 52 trips<n><n>### Input :<n><n>Input: A plane flew for 20 hours and 36000 km. To make the speed consistent throughout we apply the formula above 3600/20 = 180km /hr<n><n>### Input - A group of 6 friends

Choices:  A: determination B: upper hand C: superior D: higher position E: skill<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input<n><n>We can find the answer by using the rule of the competitors position or a person or object that has an advantage relative to others which refers to a competitor to another in sports, work, social life.<n><n>### Possible response<n><n>Let X = total marks obtained by you, and Y = total marks obtained by all other members. Then, x = Y + 5.<n><n>### Correct answer<n><n>X = 22 and Y = 19 and in this, Y + 5 = 22 then total marks obtained by you is 22.<n><n>### Example for higher position<n><n>If we take an example of sports then there is a game of American football. It is one of the sports game. There, we have seven members in a team that is playing in one team if we observe the members or the players who are playing then we see that only three players are making the advantage position.<n><n>In a game of football, there are 11 players on the field; five defenders and six attackers. The goalkeeper, also known as a keeper, is a part of the team but plays a different role than other members who do not have a defined role in defence and the attack.<n><n>### Another example for Determination<n><n>It is a kind of an example of determination. As we know that after playing cricket, the players who do not have a good performance in the game they get negative point and the players who have a good performance in cricket get points. In cricket, there is an example of the captain and the vice-captain they both have got the positive points.<n><n>### Importance for Determination in a Competition<n><n>-    Players can improve their overall game by playing against good competition<n>-	They can face pressure from the opponents<n>-	They can learn to work with others<n>-	They can gain experience<n><n>### Important role for Skill<n><n>We can say that a person who has a good skill he is going to get a high position in the competition and a person who does not have good skill he will not get position in competition.<n><n>### Other examples<n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: pets B: fills the pond C: attempt to fly D: school together E: breath in water<n><n>### Response:		crowds of fish do what: School together<n><n>## Solution Note:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Please answer each of the given instructions in your code. <n><n>### Demstration:<n>Input a 2-digit number in A1.<n>Input a 2019-style 2-digit number into the blank column at the top, without any leading zeros.<n>For example, when 12 is entered for A1, 012 is entered above.<n>The cell will expand or contract based on the number you input.<n>The code should work for numbers from 1-28, so the cells should cover these numbers.<n>You should also test whether the 127 can be accommodated.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>#### Instructions:<n><n>The goal is to create three buttons with different text under them. The buttons should be labeled "BUTTON_C1," "BUTTON-C2," and “BUTTON_S”, respectively. You will then program the function to execute the "press” event.<n><n>The "press" event will contain two if statements. The first if statement is based on the number of the button pressed. The second if statement is a switch case that compares the value of the pressed button and the other number.<n><n>These two events create an array for the values, which will then be stored. The "press" event will write a line to the output file if the number pressed is less than the other ones, it will be stored in the first array, else, it will be stored the second array.<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>##### Event Listener: Press<n><n>```javascript<n>const BUTTON_C2 = document.getElementById('BUTTON_CONTAINER');<n>BUTTON_ONE = document.getElementById('C1')<n>BUTTONS_TWO = document.getElementById('button_two')<n><n>BUTTONC2.addEventListener('click', function() {<n><n>let button_C2 = 0<n><n>button_C1.addEventListener('click', (event) => {<n>	let c1_number = event.currentTarget.innerHTML<n>	console.log(c1_number, button_C2)<n>	if (c1_number.length < 3) {<n>		
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Where could you find some airplanes that are not being used? Choices:  A: war B: aircraft carrier C: sky D: graveyard E: crash<n><n>### Response:		<n>Where could you find some aircraft that are not being used in the sky? A) Crash, B) Graveyard, C) Sky, D) Airplanes<n><n>#### Bonus:<n>Bonus points for finding an option whose spelling contains both the words aircraft and not.<n><n>### Question:<n>### Where could you find some airplane that are not being used<n>1. Choices:  A: concert B: home C: airport D: college E: university<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>### Why did you choose that?<n><n>Because it makes the most sense based off of the context.<n><n>### Input. What are two reasons?<n><n>### Dem: The instructions suggest security at colleges and universities.  It makes no mention of any other location where security drives around in golf carts.  Security at events like concerts would be patrolled by motorcycle patrol and cars.   There aren't many  places where security would drive around in golf cats to protect young adults.  Security at concerts would be too chaotic.  And no one thinks there ought to be security at airports guarding young adults.<n><n>* Incorrect answer.<n>*  The cited instructions specifically mention security guards at colleges and universites.  It doesn't say anything about events or where concerts are held.  In fact, I would say that "Young adults" is meant to be a generic category that encompasses both concert attendees and college students.  This is why you won't find much discussion of security guards at airports or protecting concert attendees in university security manuals (other than the obvious and non-contextual answer of "concert goers" for A and/or "college students" for D).<n><n>### Input A: Describe the difference, if any, between a "daily wage" earner and a salary earner when it comes to employment.<n>Answer: The daily wage earner is an employee who is hired to perform a specified task.  Salary earners are regular employees  who get paid more than other workers for their experience and qualifications.<n><n>### Why choose this answer?<n><n>Because, it's the same thing that a "regular employee" would be paid at a salary.<n><n>### Comment:<n>I don't like this answer because it is incorrect.  In addition, the wording is "employee who is hired."  What is the difference between a salary wage employee and an employee that's hired?  In this case, I don't see much difference.<n><n><n>### Input E Incorrect answer.<n><n>### Reason:<n>Because the sentence states a difference between a salary-earning person or a daily wage person.

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What planet is the atlantic ocean part of? Choices:  A: planet B: basin C: submarines D: earth E: pacific<n><n>### Response:		<n>1<n>

How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:A beaver builds structures to block what sort of feature? We answered "crowd" because it was the most frequent one of those listed, with most of the others being more rare.<n><n>### Input:"<n>Give your input to the function shown below... Write a program that outputs 10 lines of text, each with a blank space.<n><n>	def blank (num):<n>		for i in range (0, num + 1) :<n>			print ""<n>Input:How long do dogs live? Choices:  a: 80 b: 60 c: 70 years d: none<n><n>### Response:"<n>Give your response to the function shown below.<n><n>	def dog_age (pet, years):<n>	return  'Your dog would be', round(pet, 2), 'years old at 80 years.'<n>
