The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The man tried to run, but he could not. He could that he could only move by doing what? Choices:  A: stand B: go quickly C: walking D: stand still E: walk slowly<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Step 5 :<n><n>```json<n>    {<n>        "type": "paragraph",<n>        "text": "The man tried to run \n, but he could __________________. He saw he could only move ___________________________________. He realized he could run only if he stopped \n, he was running so fast.\n"<n>    }<n>```<n><n>### Input :<n><n>We have a store. The store has $28. It has 6 cans of Coke with a price of $2 each, 4 cans of juice with a price of $1. 5 cans of water that is on sale for $0.9 each and a can of beer that costs $1.2.  How much money did the store make?<n><n>### Response :<n>#### Step 1 :<n><n>```json <n>{<n>  "type": "paragraphs",<n>  "size": 3<n>}<n>```<n><n>#### Step 2 :<n><n>```json  <n><n>{<n>  "elementType": "paragraph",<n>  "elements": [<n>    {<n>      "type": "paragraph1",<n>      text: "We have a store.\n"<n>    },<n>    {<n>      text: "The store has $28.\n"<n>   . "It has 6 cans \nof Coke with a price \nof $2 each,\n". "4 cans \nof juice with a price \nof\n",<n>      "elementType": "bulletedList",<n>      "elements": [<n>        {<n>          "text": "$2"<n>        }<n>      ]<n>    },<n>   . "5 cans \nof water that is on sale \nof $0.9  "."each and \n",<n>      {<n>        text: "a can\nof beer that costs \n$1.2 \n"<n>      }<n>    ]<n>"<n>}<n>```<n>#### Step 3:<n><n>```json 					<n>{<n>  "text": "How much money did the store \n make?",<n>  "type": "'Paragraph'"<n>}<n>```<n>### Output:<n><n>```json<n> {<n>  "type": <n>    "paragraph",<n>    "text":<n>"6 cans of Co~ke that

How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:A small dog is lost in New England, where would it likely be found? The first 18<n>### apples are red, the next 8 are green, and the last 7<n>### are yellow. The game ends when all have been collected.<n><n>### If the number of red apples exceeds total of collected<n>### apples, then the number of collected apples is returned<n>### as a parameter.  If red apples are smaller in total, <n>### then that is returned as a parameter.<n>### Similarly, if green apples are larger in total, then that is returned<n>### in the second parameter.  Finally, if total apples<n>### collected is greater of less than total number of yellow apples then<n>### the third parameter is returned.<n>### Explanation:<n>### We want to collect all 33 apples in order.  <n>### The code that checks if there's a red apple and how many<n>### we need checks if we have gathered an apple and not too many<n>### or too few for a specific color.  If after every set of 3<n>### apples we get out of apples of the color we expect, an apple<n>### must be counted and this will continue while all apples are gathered.<n><n>### This loop ensures every set of apples will<n>### be checked once and the final state of red apples, green apples,<n>### and yellow apples are checked after the complete loop<n>### and the final count returned.<n><n>### Input (all together):<n>### There are 33 apple on the first level. The first 18 are red, the next<n>### 8 are green and the last 7 are yellow. The game is over

Choices:  A: lake B: aquariums C: swimming pool D: pond E: childrens pools<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>In[4]:def answerquestion(choices,answer):<n>    <n>    """This will return a list with the option which is true,<n>     and the answer for false"""<n>    <n>    answer=[False,""]<n>    <n>    if answer == True: # checks if answer is equal to true<n>        answer = True   <n>        <n>    choices.sort()<n>    choices.pop(0) # deletes the first item from the choices<n>    index = choices.index(answer) # get number of option<n>    <n>    return  [index, answer] <n>    <n>```<n><n>### Input<n>The total number of books owned by a student are ten less than three times the number of math books owned by the student. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Where is a bay always found? Choices:  A: lake B: manhattan C: shoreline D: coastal area E: los angeles<n><n>### Response:		A (Answer:a)<n><n>### Input :How much is 8 times the total price for a pack of 400 strawberries and a pack of 18 oranges? Choices:  A: plain B: cold C: dull D: bad E: wet<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. Option A.<n><n>### Input<n>Write the code to perform the following function.<n><n>### Function Request:<n>Input: The function returns an array of strings where each position in the array represents the number of words in the sentence that include that letter.<n>Output: Return the correct sentence<n>Input: For the purposes of this function, "d" and "'s" are treated as two words.<n>Return: [{ "c":"2" },{"d":"7" },{"e":"1" },{"i":"0" },{"o":"2" },{"s":"2" },{"t":"3" },{"w":"0" },{"y":"0" }]<n><n>### <n>```javascript<n>function letters(wordSentence){<n>  var wordSentences = wordSentence.split(' ');<n>  var wordFrequency = map(wordSentences,function(sentence){<n>  sentence = sentence.split(' ');  <n>  return sentence.reduce((accumulate,currentValue) => accumulate[currentValue] = currentValue.forEach);<n>  document.getElementById("letterFrequency").innerHTML = wordFrequency ;<n>  return wordFrequency;<n>})<n>}<n>```<n>

It didn't matter.   He didn't heave anything to put it on, and he lacked the what to balance it? Choices:  A: tenacity B: hands C: coaster D: skill E: breaking<n><n>### Response:		 Explanation:<n>```<n>If you want to know some words used in the sentence, you can download the PDF here:[https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/deadliestwarrior/images/0/0f/Wordsusedbyenglish.pdf](https://static.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/9/92/Wordsusedby%2be%2bre%2b1.pdf)<n><n>There is a special rule in the reading section, and if you don't understand the words with a simple explanation or context, you will have 1 minute to ask for your clarification.  Then you need 1 minute to continue reading.  So, you need to get used to the special words you don't know!<n>```<n><n>### Input：It is estimated that nearly 650 million children younger than 5 die from mostly preventable causes. (...) If 310,000 children die a day, how many do die each hour?<n><n>### Response：68,750<n><n>### Task：Answer the following two multiple choice questions that relate to the reading.<n><n>### Q1. The first paragraph is written in which way?<n><n>### A. The first sentence is a _______ sentence that expresses general factual information. Choices: A: declarative B: exclamative C: affirmation D: interrogative<n><n>### Q2. The second paragraph is written in which ways?<n><n>### Explanation：<n>In the second paragraph, it introduces a new topic, which is called Global Hunger Solution, so it should be an exclamative sentence (exclamative sentences tell or ask a surprise or strong emotion).  If it is an interrogative sentence, it should be: “It is estimated that ______ million children younger than 2 years die from hunger each year.”(because it is a question sentence).<n>

If there's anything the student is doing well then you should mention it. A response that just corrects mistakes and says there are more errors is not helpful. <n><n>* If there are errors in the assignment, please give the candidate and specific feedback on how the candidate can improve their work. Remember that the main course objective is to teach critical thinking. If the candidates gets it wrong, then tell them how they are wrong.<n><n>* If the candidate needs some practice, please tell them the particular concepts that the the need to focus on, and then have them do some extra tasks on the platform. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What do people use to absorb extra ink from a fountain pen? Choices:  A: shirt pocket B: calligrapher's hand C: inkwell D: desk drawer E: blotter<n><n>### Response:		 B: calligraphers hand<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. Input: Adam bought 3.5 kilograms in total.<n>2. Input: The number of goals against Barca accounted for 20% <n>3. Input: The number is at 660.<n>4. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The man went to clown college, he had always want to run away with the what? Choices: A. 2 bottles B. 24 beers C. 10 beer D. 72 beers E. 60 beer<n><n>### Response9<n>Adam had 24 beers.<n><n>### What you learned?<n>This activity was to use the question mark, exclamation, and period, also how to use the quotes around the statements.<n><n>### How you did on this activity?<n>I did a good job on this activity.<n><n>### Did you ask any questions about this activity? If you didn’t ask any questions, tell why not. If so, tell about or show what was confusing or frustrating.<n>><n>### Assignment: Use the question mark, expection mark, and period. A person does not have a caring heart if it means a person who works outside in a hot factory, making products. A person with a caring heart is a human. We know that human is a species, so it is also the answer for species C. If it asks for “all mammals” then there are many choices but we know that only humans are carers, unlike the rest of the animals.<n><n>Input:<n>####How many people in the United States does the average doctor interact with per day? The first box contains 5 apples, the second contains 4 apples, and the third contains 2 apples. The store owner picks an apple from the box and gives it to his customer. Then he moves the apple in the box down (i.e. the first box is filled, the second box is partially filled, and the third box is not filled). The picking algorithm is: Each box is picked first, then the customer gets the apple and the picker moves the apple down.<n><n>  The second box is full of apples, so only the first box and the third box remain. The owner picks the first apple of the first box and gives it to the customer and then moves the apple from the first box down. The picking algorithm is identical until the final box is empty. The third box is empty, so the customer gets the apple from there, and the owner restocks the box by replacing the apple that was in the box.<n>  Then, the owner adds some apples to both the second box and the

The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Where could a printer be used by thousands of people? Choices:  A: school B: home office C: people store D: print shop E: newspaper office<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>-A<n><n>### Input<n><n>In a contest, the 11 judges rated the 75 applicants across the fields of art, science, literature and music, based on a rubric: 5 for Excellent, 4 for High, 3 for Average, 2 for Low, and 1 for Very Low. Where did  he go to get more? Choices:  A: desk drawer B: cup C: pencil case D: shelf E: office depot<n><n>### Response:		<n>* Write a statement that selects and outputs all Phrases where "C" equals "Pencil Case". There must be one instance where "C" equals<n>* "Pencil Case", for all Phrases.<n><n>This will be achieved by applying the match() function to only select Phrases when C = Pencil Case.<n>```<n>(print if A equals "pencil case")<n>```<n><n>```<n>(match("A") "pencil case" (if false print) (next print) (next print))<n>```<n><n>```java<n>if ("pencil case".equals(A)) {<n>    System.out.println("A equal to pencil case");<n>} else {<n>    System.err.println("A not equal to pencilcase");<n>}<n>```<n>* This function returns (True/False), print statement is called for true. For false, no print statement is called. And the match will be called next time<n>* Once the match is completed, the statements after the match will call. For example in our case, we are checking if "A" equals to "Pencilcase" or not. If it does, it print "A equal to pencils." If it doesn't it print "B equal to Pencilcase."<n><n>* Then we check "B", similarly we apply the match(), we check the "D" and print something like this if "D" equals "desk drawer" or "cup"<n><n>### Input answer: 100<n><n>### <n>* Create your own function named "selectPhrase" that takes "B" and "A" as inputs and applies Match() to "A" and "B".

Be sure to explain your decision, if any, to have two answers provided by two different programmers or have only one (in case the two are the same).<n><n>### Responses:<n><n>### Insturctions: Write a program that will calculate an approximation of pi. See the solution below. Be sure to explain how you arrived at each step. Use at least two separate functions.<n>### Solution:<n>- A function is a sequence of instructions defined by a label.<n>- To calculate pi, we will divide 100 integers.<n>- function PiCalc(num):<n>    int pi = 1;<n>    num -= 1;<n>    for (1; num > 0; num--)<n>       pi *= num;<n>    return pi;<n><n>### Inststructions: The following program has not implemented correctly. It should be as simple as you have written it. If you can't think of any ideas then explain why it is an invalid program.<n>### Solution by programmer B:<n><n>### 1. Input,<n>### 2. Loop while (0<y<9),<n>### 3. Add the value of the square of n to i,<n>### 4. Print the value of i,<n>### Solution by B:<n>- If the integer is negative and not equal to 0, the loop will not end. <n>- If the integer n is greater than 8, the loop will not be able to iterate. <n><n>### Instructon: Write a program that displays the first 10 integers larger than 15.<n><n>### Solution by C:<n>- A for loop is a sequence of statements that is repeated over a number of steps. <n>- While Loop: While the expression evaluates to ‘true’, it keeps executing the code within loop.  <n>- The condition x>8 evaluates to true, so the loop will continue to run until x has a value greater than or equal to 8. <n><n>##|<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: overhead compartment B: chair C: hospital D: in shirt E: business meeting<n><n>### Response:		The person would more likely bring their attache case to a business meeting.<n>### Hint:Choices:  A B C<n>### Response: Choice (C)<n>### Hint 1<n>```python<n>if "hospital" in choice or "in shirt" in choice:<n>	print("Choice (C)")<n>elif "office" in choice:<n>print("Choice (A)")<n>```<n>### Hint2<n>```python<n>while True:<n>    question = input("Input:Enter a letter. Type another letter to continue. ")<n>    if question == "A":<n>        break<n>    if question == 'B':<n>        break<n>    elif question == 'C':<n>        break<n><n>def choice():<n>    attache = input("Input:What would you take? ").upper()<n>    choice = input("Input:Choose one: Choices:  A B D E ")<n>    attache_case = input("Input:Type the letter of your choice: ")<n>    option = input("Input:Select one of the letters or type another letter: ")<n>    if attache_case == 'A':<n>        if option == 'A':<n>            print("Letter:  A ")<n>    elif attache_case == "B":<n>        if option == "B":<n>            print("Lettres:  B ")<n>```<n>### Instruction<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions using the hints given below. John bought them because he knew that they wold look good.<n><n>    Where might they be installed<n><n>	Ans: kitchen<n><n><n>![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/91130263/172352620-80506adf-1270-47d1-bf68-de0e5d454204.png)<n><n><n><n><n>### Input :Including his tips, Dante makes $550 a week at the coffee shop. How much of that amount goes directly into his savings each week?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Input : including his tip dante makes 550 a week as a coffeeshop employee. how much of that goes directly into his savngs each week?<n>Output: 5% of his paycheque<n><n>He gets paid 550 every week (52 weeks a year).<n>His savings/week equals(80 * 4 weeks) - 550<n>His savings is 52+550 = 602.<n><n>His 602 is deducted from his 550 and the remainder is his savings and is 46.28<n>46/550 = 21.9 % <n><n><n>!["image"](https://user-Images.githubusercontent.io/media/7a3621f102d7ec161e3c6ce7/20693993957836/screen-shot-2021-05-28-at-18.42.30.png)<n><n>### Instructon: You will be working with a partner. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:If one sees a fox and is standing in a landlocked, southern state, where is this person? Subtract from the expression and distribute and simplify<n>2. Repeat the first step<n>3. Write the answer and do not simplify it unless asked to<n><n>* Note: There isn't one right answer.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><b>Step 1:</b> The expressions can be rewritten as:<n><br/>  \(<n>  4+(2\*5)-(6*3)=4+(2\*10)-(6*3) = 18```<n><n><b>Step2:</b> Continue simplifying the expressions one by one as follows:<n><n><br/> 9-15=6<br/><n><n>18-22=-4<br/><n>30-32=(-2)<br/<n>437-431=6<br/<n>

Hint: The map has hour markers at 1, 2, 3 am, etc.<n><n>### Solution <n>8 hours<n><n><n>### Question : A man is driving from Tucson, Arizona to Dallas, Texas at 75 mph. He takes the quickest route possible from Tucson, stopping at a diner for lunch every 6 hours and a motel for the night. If the man’s drive takes 30 hours and he has spent a total of $260, how much did it cost the man to spend the night at the motel and eat lunch for eight meals? (Assume the man eats the motel lunch and no other lunch at the diner.)<n><n>### Answer<n>13 hours, 175 dollars <n><n>### QuestionA family takes a 5-hour drive to visit relatives.  The trip takes 20% longer than it would have taken by staying on the freeway.<n><n>###

She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What are students trying to do? Choices:  A: study philosophy B: become adult C: ask questions D: further education E: study together<n><n>### Response:		What did the students do? Choices: A: They watched a movie about philosophy’s history B: They asked each question about topics C: they study hard to get a good grade D: They wrote out the philosophical questions they were working on E: They ate cheese and crackers together<n><n>### Input : A: They watched a documentary. B: They studied the document. C: They answered questions. D: They took practice tests. E: They studied with the aid of software<n><n>### Response : What did the students do? A: They didn't get enough sleep because they stayed up late. B: They worked together. C: They asked a tutor to help them with the documentary. D: They reviewed all the material. E: They worked separately.<n><n>### Input A: She works hard. B: She spends a lot of money. C: She likes to go on vacation. D: She likes to travel. E: She is too busy.<n><n>#### Response A: Although she is busy, she does not get enough sleep. B: Although she likes to spend money, she does not get to visit friends as much as she wants. C: Although she loves traveling, she doesn't get to work on her hobbies as much. D: Although she works hard, she does not have enough time to socialize. E: Although she enjoys being busy, she has to keep up with deadlines.<n><n><n>### Input<n>I'm wondering about<n>### Response<n>I am afraid it might be too much for you to learn about that subject.<n>### Input<n>If I read more about that, would I be able to answer all your questions?<n>### Response<n>Yes, but if you want to learn about it, you should study more now, because you only have so much time to learn.<n>### Input <n><n>### Choice<n>She is willing to spend a few hours a day on the subject for a few months.<n>### Choice <n><n>She has little time for studying.<n>### Choices<n><n>She does not want to work much on the subject because she is busy with other things.<n>### A Choice of Replies<n>She believes that this is the best she can do for herself.<n>### B Choice <n><n>I think she does not need to

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:If I screw a chain ring onto something, what am I fixing? She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Where would you find some swords in your house? Choices:  A: sheath B: sword closet C: collection D: container called scabbard E: museum<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: A museum is a big building with hundreds and thousands of items like swords which are displayed for people to go and look at. It's a type of building, not a physical location of that specific item.<n>You definitely didn't see the sword in a museum.<n><n>B: A sword closet sounds like a place where people wear the shirts they don't love very much anymore, and they are kept there with the rest of their closet.<n>Swords are kept in their sheaths and not in closets where they can come under. They are generally kept outside for better protection, because when someone goes to the weaponry closet, they will not see swords.<n><n>C: A collection is a set of things that you like like and appreciate and are usually kept together in one place where they can be seen or appreciated.  <n>What you want to find there is a sword collection. When you find it, you can see how many swords are in that place. <n><n>D: A container called scabbard sounds like a giant plastic bag that you have to carry your sword with it for protection.  <n>The container sounds like where people keep things for protection from theft and other forms of protection.<n><n>E: E is also correct because all of these choices have things to see.  The best one is E because if you are looking for a museum, you could just ask someone to take you there and tell you what they have, then you could make your own decision about what is in your house and what isn't. <n><n>### Input<n>A: A car.  B: A bike.  C: A bus.<n><n>### Response<n>Answer A is correct, because the first answer is also an answer - A car is the most practical option for finding a bike, because with a 100x100 grid, you would not be able to distinguish A bike from B with only a pair of eyes, and it is not possible to pick every single item from a grid using just the power of the eyes. This is why using a car to find a bike would be more efficient.<n><n>### Input <n>A:  a chicken B: a pig C: a lion <n><n>### Response <n>Answer C is correct because a chicken is the smallest and most easily overlooked animal, while a lion is

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Why would you not want to be working with wood? Choices:  A: blisters B: frustration C: being paid D: make money E: money<n><n>### Response:		<n>In most cases, wood should be avoided. Most things that involve woodworking are messy and/or dangerous. So you risk either getting injured or having a huge mess to clean up. There are also fewer options available for woodworking, so it's less convenient than other forms of construction. And you have to get more upfront materials before starting, so it's really not as economical as other options.<n><n><n>### Input:"What time is it?" A: five B: two C: six D: nine E: ten<n><n>### Response:"It's (whatever time you answered above)", or "noon" or "four pm".<n>### Input:How much money does the president of H&H Grocery Store earn? Choices:  a: $500,000 b: $100,00 c: $1,000  d: $0.1<n><n>### Response:$100,010,000,001,000,101,001,110,111<n><n>### Input :I've been sick. I don't feel well. I'm having difficulty understanding  your response.<n><n>### Response :I suggest trying again. If you still cannot understand, we recommend switching to another response engine.<n><n>### Input:{your response}. {question}.<n>#### Response :What?<n><n><n><n>### Above output:I don't recommend switching response engines. I like this one the best!<n><n>### Input:`How much is 555?` [Your response].<n>#### Response :I'm really tired (in a sad tone). My favorite number is 555!<n><n>### Response should look similar to:I'm really tired. My favorite number is 777!<n><n>### Output should look similar to:555!<n>

It is also known as the Cottonmouth snake, the Water moccasin snake, the Black water snake, or simply Cottonmouth or Water moccasin.  Choice: "E"<n><n>### Reference links: http://www.cnn.com/2013/12/11/us/missouri-snake/index.html?iid=article_sidebar

It was divided into 13 districts and built at right angles to each other.  Each neighborhood had a tall stone column at some point which made a good place to put your home.  There were two or three levels to living in the houses.  Each level had a kitchen, which was where you kept all your food and cooked on a fire inside.  There were several people in each house and they each got a bedroom and a place to work in the day time.  The people worked in the day time and would watch the sunset and eat dinner in the evening time.<n>```<n><n>### Questions: Answer each following question.<n><n>#### Question: Which one of each group of numbers is odd?<n><n>#### Answer: 1, 5, 7, 11,<n><n>#### Question: 25 is approximately _____.<n><n>#### Answer: between 25.6 and 26<n><n>#### Question: Find the greatest common factor of 5 and 7.<n><n>#### Answer (Explanation):<n><n>The greatest common factor is 1<n><n>### Input Output:<n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>1999 was a wonderful year. For example, if someone asked "What is love?" and answered "it is painful", this answer is technically correct, since both 'pain' and 'love' are feelings. Therefore, the phrase could be used to ask an absolute question (can be answered with Yes or No) or a relative question (cannot be answered with Yes or no). Another way to phrase this question would be "Does love always last forever?" and would need to be answered by someone familiar with the context of the love and time period.

Choices:  A: pool table B: toy box C: playroom D: park E: closet<n><n>### Response:		Billy might be in any of these places.  All these places have distinctive traits that make them different from each other.<n><n>### Input : You cannot have three apples and four oranges (orange is neither an apple nor an apple).<n><n>### Response : You cannot have three oranges and four apples.  However, you can have two apples and have three oranges.  You cannot have exactly four apples because that would mean that you have one apple left over which means you must have five.<n><n>###Input: A man has 200 dollars in the left pocket and 150 dollars in the right pocket. He wants to have an equal amount of money in both pockets. How can he do so?<n><n>###Response: The man can transfer $50 from his right pocket to his left pocket.<n><n>The first test I will be creating is the Clean-up test. I was inspired to create this test to reinforce the use of functions. I felt that this would be an appropriate assessment tool because it would evaluate many key points that I had taught throughout the 7 week program. I felt that the prompt would be easily understood and that all the students would be able to grasp the concept behind it. This test would be given within the last day of the course to ensure that all of the material that had been covered was understood well. The prompt would ask them to choose a function based on criteria that they were presented. The students would have 20 minutes to work on the quiz and after that, they would be able to complete this assignment on their own time and submit via Canvas for a grade by the teacher.<n><n>The second test that I will be creating is called the Invent a Machine test. It requires the student to come up with an invention. That invention needs to meet 5 criteria:<n><n>1. Have a function<n>2. Be able to store information<n>3. Be able to do certain calculations<n>4. Have 3 inputs<n>5. Has 1 output<n><n>The students will be required to come up with a device that will allow them to do all of those things. They could come up with the concept and a drawing. This test would be assigned to the students as a final assignment at the end of the unit. I chose to do this test as a final because I felt that it would help to evaluate the students comprehension of the major key

Choices:  A: call 911 B: enjoy yourself C: get drunk D: having sex E: meet new people<n><n>### Response:		You need at least one drink before going to party to have fun. Choices: A: car B: a dog C: skateboard D: bicycle<n><n>### Response-Question: Dog is my favorite pet. I get around the town with a bike. Dog can help us walk to some distance.<n><n>### Task: Create a class called VendingMachine. When it is created, store the name and cost of items in it. Create instance and add the items. Display the cost. Create a function to buy the items from your VendingMachine instance using cost variable.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>#### create the class:<n><n>    public class Tester <n>    {<n>      public class VendingMachine<n>      {<n>        public string name;<n>        public string cost;<n>        public int[] items;<n>      }<n>    }<n><n>Then call the factory function to create the instance. You can get the instance by name.<n><n>    public Tester t = new Tester();<n>    t.getVender(“Cool Vendor”);<n>    VendingMachine v = t.FactoryInstance(“Cool Vender”);<n>    Console.WriteLine(v.cost);<n><n>#### Buy the Items:<n><n>    Vender vender = new Vender(“Cool Buyer”, “4 bucks”);<n>    int itemCost = 12; // You can change this<n>    int quantity = 100;<n><n>    for (int i = 0; i < quantity; i++)<n>    {<n>      vender.BuyOneItem(“Coconut”, itemCost);<n>    }<n><n>    Console.WriteLine($“I have {quantity} Coco Nuts!”);<n>    Console.Read();<n><n>#### Output:<n><n>    I have 100 Coco Nuts!<n><n><n>### Task : <n><n>### What is a name of a person’s favorite sport.

What is the first letter of the birds name?<n><n>### Choices:<n><n>### Answer: A = The bird's name begins with letter A<n><n>### Questions: There are two different plants located next to each other. Plant A requires 3 gallons of water per day while Plant B requires 200 gallons of water per week. Neighboring houses supply the water for both plants. When the neighbor is able to provide enough free water for A, we say that A is water sufficient. But since water is expensive, we only water the plants with free water when water is sufficient for A. In general, the amount of water left to provide to Plant B after plant A is water sufficient is equal to the difference between the amount of water needed and what is available for Plant A. We can also say that the amount of water not needed by A is excess and should be redirected to water Plant B. You are trying to maximize the water provided to Plant B. For n=1, 2, 3, 4, the maximum water provided was 213.5, 1G, 0.21g, 0.202g. Find the number n of cases in which the maximum water provided to Plant B is at most 0.15 gallons.<n>### Answer: 3, 17, 26<n><n>### Question(Above):<n><n>### Answer(Above): n = 7<n><n>### Question([Above](https://github.com/Mihayoyo/Mihayo-Yoyo.github.io/blob/master/exercises/0618/1.md)):<n>### What does 5 - (1 - 2) mean?<n>### Answer([Above](https)):<n><n>### Question (Above):<n><n><n>### Answer for the question above:<n><n>### Question ([Above](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4589201/error-with-the-following-line-
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:A musician is most likely to perform a concerto for clarinet with what type of group? Choices:  A: music store B: orchestra C: jazz band D: rock band E: music studio<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>#### How It Works:<n>The "A musician is most like to perform a conceret for clarinet with what" part of the task is the instruction, and the remaining options constitute response prompts to a multiple choice question.<n>The task requires the input in the response to be a multiple choice question format. This format will make the code more easily readable.<n>The response should be of the "A musician is more likely to perform a consert at the" question type.<n><n>The response should have one multiple choice option to choose from.<n>When coding a multiple choice option, you will have to:<n>First, define a number for the value, or number of choice, you would like to use. Second, define a choice that includes a numbered value.<n><n>#### Sample Output:<n><p>There are <b>1</b> multiple choice format in the question below:</p><n><n>A) 32<br><n>-1) music store<br><n>-2) orchestra<br><n>-3) jazz band<br><n>-4) rock band<br><n><n>B) 52<br><n><n><p>You are correct.</p><n><n><p style="color: green;"><n><strong>There are <b>"1"</b> format in the question below.</strong><n></p><n><n>#### Challenge Solution Solution:<n><n>```js<n>const prompt1 = 'A musician is most likley to perform a concerte for clarinet with what? A: music store B. Orchestra C. Jazz band D: rock band';<n><n>const ans = prompt(prompt1);<n><n>if (ans == 'A') {<n>  console.log("You are correct.")<n><n>} else {<n>  console.error("Wrong!")<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Input :Jonathan takes a flight to a tourist place in California from New York on June 5 while his plane leaves on 9th on the same day. Add two more response in two different questions<n>```<n><response><n>    if People are vegetarian, they sun themselves.<n>    if People are not vegetarian, they are sun themselves.<n></response><n>```<n><n>## <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Answer: (A)<n><n>### Response<n><n>```<n> <question><n>   <if text="if (people are vegetarian)" text="do they believe in God" answer="(A)"/><n>   <else text="if (people aren't)" text="do they" answer="(B)"/><n> </question><n> <else text="do all people" text="believe in god"/><n></if><n>```<n><n><n>Output<n>```<n> Answer: B<n> If people are not vegetarian, do they sun themselves.<n>```<n><n>If given more output, the steps are in order: <n><n>1. Add this line<n>```<n> <else text="if all people" text="eat hamburgers"/><n></if> <n>```<n><n>2. Add two more output in two different questions<n><n>## 2<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the question.<n><n>## Demonstration:<br/><n>Input: If people are in their twenties, they eat a lot of fruit.<n><n>Output: They eat hamburgers a lot.<n><n>### Response:(If people are in their twes)<br/><n>Answer: They eat hamburger a lot.<n><n><n>### 3<n><n>### Instractions:<n><n>## Demostration:<br/>Input: <n><n>If people are in their thirties, they sun themselves more than people are not in their thirties.<n>If women are single, they drink more wine than women who are not single.<n><n>Output: <br/><n>If people are in ther thirties, they drink more wine.  <n>If women are single and older than people who are not

How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:What do humans do when they want to reproduce? Choices:  A: cause spots on leaf B: healthy C: wellness D: ball stopped E: cure<n><n>### Response:		Healthy<n><n>### Instructions:Choose one of the tasks below.<n><n>### Task:In the first task you enter the weights in pounds for the woman and the man. Your task is to calculate their combined weight in pounds.<n><n>###  Task:In the second task you enter the weights of a horse, the weights in kilograms and the distance between two points in kilometers to tell how long it will take your horse to travel that distance.<n><n>### Response<n><n>In the first task,I want to use the weights information to calculate their combined weight. First,I will write the formula for weight in pounds,W in pounds = m1 * g *(h1-h2) where Wis the weight in lbs, m1 is the weight in kgs,g=9.8 and h1 and h2 are heights in feet. Then the formula changes to W=m1 * 9.8* (h2-h1). I will divide W,Wpounds = m1 * 9.5.H2 * (h1-h2). Now, I will substitute for each variable. M1 is weight in in kilograms,it is 159.9. H1 and H2 is the height in feet. H1 is 67 and H2 is 64. I will substitute this into my formula. W=159.9*9.5 * 67 and 64. Finally, W=14209.5. It is equal to.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Jan went to the auditorium and listened to the speech. Where might he be? Choices:  A: crowd B: high school C: city D: somewhere E: theater<n><n>### Response:		 C: city<n><n>### Input :  Fletcher is the CEO of a big company. He visits 5 different countries and attends the meeting in each country’s capitol. What’s the first country that he will visit?<n><n>### Response : A: The United States of America<n><n>### Input  :  You’re looking for a new pet, which can be difficult. Here are some tips. 1. Be prepared to take good care of it.  2. Be sure to visit the animal shelter.  3. Go to a pet show.  4. Choose a dog.  5. Find a veterinarian.  6. Keep cats away from dogs.  7. Go to an adoption place.  8. Don’t put the pet in the carrier.  9. Have a place for your pet to sleep. What two tips can you choose from?<n><n>### Tips : 6-8<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Tip - 7(Go to an adoption place.)<n><n>### Trap - 8(Have a place for your pet)<n><n>### Ticket to Ride<n><n>### Input - 1. A man who goes to the bakery to buy a bread should pay 2.5$. A woman buys two bagels from it. She pays more than the man. How much more? <n><n>### Tract - 1$<n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:We were having a canned food drive and I needed to pick up some contributions, where did I go? Choices:  A: shelf B: cellar C: refrigerator D: cupboard E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		<n>In a cupboard<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The wheel was loose, and threatened to fall off when they were what? Choices:  A: footloose B: sailing C: fast D: tighten E: bind<n><n>### Response:		E: bind<n><n>#### Detailed description of the solution:<n><n>We have 2 words (tight and loose). Tight is a synonym to bind, and loose is a synonym to footloose. Then, we can see the word, 'fall'. Fall is a synonym to loose. Therefore, the wheel is falling of the truck when they are footing loose.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: A 20-foot-wide trailer had to fit within a 15-foot wide bay. How many times did the trailer travel around the bay?<n>Answer: 102,400<n><n>#### Detailed explanation of the solution:<n>- Firstly, they would like to know the trailer is 20 foot wide and the length of the bay is 15 foot.<n>- Then, the equation they have is: Length of the bay/20-foot wide trailer<n>- The result is Length of the bay/(20-foot wide) = 1/ (20/20) = 1 -> number of times<n><n>### Input <n>Input: The team got 40 hours of overtime.  They also started an an hour later than usual for one day due to construction on the highway.  How long is the extra breaktime added to the total if the overtime takes a 50% hit due to overpaying for some of the hours?<n>Answer: 225<n><n><n>#### Detailed solution :<n><n>A) The total time they worked was 40 hours + extra time for construction on the highway, and extra hour for overtime<n><n>B) 50% of overtimes they worked were paid 1.5times of usual - the time is decreased by 45.75 hours<n><n>C) Remainder time : 40 + (50-0.5*45.75) = 70 (40 total - 22.5 extra hours)<n>

How much would you have to pay for two bottles of wine?<n>Answer:  $22<n><n>### General Examples<n><n>A box of donuts costs $2.40 but doubles in size for $1.60.<n>A pint of milk costs $1.80, but doubles in size for 80 cents.<n>A pint of chocolate milk costs about $3.20.<n>A pint and a half of fried chicken costs $6.00.<n>1/3 of one and one half pound of frozen meat costs $6.32.<n>1/8 of one and two thirds pounds of frozen meat costs almost $5.00.<n>

Choices:  A: complications B: tiredness C: anger D: trial E: court case<n><n>### Response:		<n>- Complications: A person might be facing any sort of problem or any uncomfortable situation so he/she might bring civil action to deal with this issue.<n>- Tiredness: A person might be physically and mentally drained due to a busy schedule or any other sort of stress so he/she might feel compelled by tiredness for taking the next step of civil action.<n>- Anger: Anger is a kind of emotion which might make an individual take the next step of getting involved in the civil action in order to get rid of some problem or the root of the problem.<n>- Trial: Civil action includes many trials, investigations, and inquiries in order to get the justice that a person wants.<n>- Court Case: Civil action involves court cases to get over a dispute successfully.<n><n>### Input How might one demonstrate physical and mental agility? Choices:  * A: exercise * B: stretch * C: yoga * D: cardio * E: relaxation * F: deep breath * G: all of the above * H: one or more of these * <n><n>### Response<n>- Mental relaxation requires deep breath and yoga is the best way to do so.<n>- To remain physically fit one must do cardio, exercise, and yoga.<n>- Any sort of physical and mental practice that involves stretch, cardio, exercise, yoga, deep breath, and relaxation requires agility.<n><n>### The average rate at which she loses weight is 2 pounds per month. What's her weight in pounds after 12 years?<n><n>### Calculation<n>- Weight at time = 71 years<n>- Average Rate = 2 pounds per month<n><n>### Step 1: Use 71 instead of years, and put weight in its place<n><n>(12*71)*2 = 3172<n><n>### Step2: Put 71 instead of 12, 2 pounds instead of 2, and 3172 instead of 12 years<n><n>(71)*2 =3172<n>2 pounds is 2*16 ounces.<n><n>5.5*2=11*2=1276<n><n><n>### After 12 years, how much did the boy and girl each pay

However, the halls are eerily quiet. Anna suddenly notices the gear box in her pocket. She opens the box and looks inside. “Hmmm,” she thinks. “I’ve not been to school here in years. How could I have forgotten something like this?” Anna removes all the gears and puts the entire thing back into her pocket. “Okay, here goes.” She is now certain that nothing should be there. However, Anna can almost feel a vibration behind each of her ears. Suddenly Anna realizes that these noises are coming from her pocket. With her free hand, she reaches into the pocket. She begins to pull out a strange machine with all gears looking at her. “Wow,” Anna thinks aloud. “I’ve never seen this machine before. I don’t even know where it came from. There is no one else around.” She holds it up as the gears begin to glow an amber yellow. Anna feels it shift under her grip. She realizes one thing: the device is not going to stop vibrating without her help. The other thing is the last thing she expected: the machine is trying to escape. What Anna decides to do is try to place the machine in her backpack, which is already quite full. As soon as Anna opens her backpack, several strange mechanical bugs begin to move forward rapidly and disappear into thin air. They leave behind a cloud of blue dust.<n>

Choices:  A: fly B: buzz C: move D: honey E: help flowers pollenate<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>- The correct answer is A : fly.<n><n>- The sample input reads: John hated mosquitoe. It wasn't the blossucking that he despised, it was that they made what? Choices : A fly B buzz C moving D honey E help flowers pollentate<n><n>- The sample output reads : The answer is A : fly<n><n>- If you answer A : flower, John will be irritated because the answer is flower. John hated mosquitos and they are not flowers.<n><n>- If you were to answer B : buzz C : move, you would be asked: "What does flowing buzzing move do?"<n><n>- If you answered B : buzz it would not answer John's question.<n><n>## ----------------------------------------------------------<n><n>### Input :  John hated mosquitees. It wasn't  the bloodsucking  that he disliked. It was that the insects  made what? Choices? A : fly B : buzz C: move  D : honey E : help  flowers pollenate.<n><n>### Response :   A  <n><n>### Instuction:<n><n>- The input is as described before.  You should answer the question by the correct answer. <n><n>- The answer is A flower.  John hates mosquitoes and they are not flowers, so it is incorrect. <n><n>- If you reply B : Buzz, C : Move, or D : Honey, you would be asked, "What did flowing, buzzing, and moving do?"<n><n>- Buzz, Move, and Honey are incorrect answers to John's question. <n><n>## -----------------------------<n><n>### Input  :  The input is as described in part 1.<n><n>### Input2 :   The answer to: What did all these buzzing, moving, and flowing do?<n><n>### Response  :   C  <n><n>###  Instuction:<n>- The correct answer to C :Move is that mosquitoes and other bugs are fanning flowers to get pollen, not fertilize them. Pollen is the male element in the seed and is not fertilizing but fanning the female flower.<n><n>-

They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:The department store is located in the Northwest USA.  Where might it be? Choices:  A: new york B: big city C: town D: idaho E: shopping mall<n><n>### Response:		<n>New York<n><n>### Input<n>Joe's house has a maximum height of 8 feet above the ground. How tall is the tree in front of Joe's house?<n><n>### Response<n>70 feet tall<n><n>### Input :Aaron and Sarah are sitting across a table from each other.  Aaron is to Sarah's left.  Sarah is to Aaron's right.  Aaron, Sarah, and another friend are sitting at the table.  Who's to the left of him, and who's to the right of him?<n><n>Ans. Sarah<n><n>### Input <n>The two-bedroom apartment is 20 feet wide and 50 feet long. The bedroom is 9 feet wide and 14 feet long. Choices:  A: drinkable B: junk food C: medicine D: antidote E: nutrient<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>The food poisoning is caused by many germs including parasites, bacteria, and viruses.<n><n>When food poisoning occurs, bacteria toxins, produced by spoiled food, enter the bloodstream through the intestines.  <n>Some food poisoning results from spoiled food or from food kept at unsafe temperatures.<n><n>The most common symptom of food poisoning is vomiting and diarrhea, which is caused by the toxins.<n><n>### Input&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; :How many ounces of water weigh 16 pounds? Choices: 1: 1024 Oz. 2: 864 Oz. 3: 1923 4: 802 Oz. E: 1673 Oz. <n><n>### Response&nbsp;&nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; :3<n><n>### Input &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\em{John}: 8 hours   &nbsp;&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&em{Sarah}: 2 hours  <n><n>&nbsp;&nbsp; \em{John}: The time Sarah spent in the studio is longer<n><n>### \textit{John} to\textit{Sarah}\textbf{"We have to finish this task before the end of the week, and I think we're a little behind."} Response\textbf{" We worked longer, I thought we were done before the end of yesterday."} Reply\textbf{" You are not paying enough attention. As we are all working together it is crucial for you to get your work done."} Response<n><n>### \textbf{Sarah} to\textbf{John}\em{"It's really not my fault that I'm not catching up. I'm doing my best here"}\textbf{"You think so? It really looks like you don't care enough right now."} Reply\em{"Sorry. I just feel a bit exhausted. I guess I need to work more today. I will try to do my best today and tomorrow also."} Response<n><n>    \em{"I think we are all quite tired now. It's a long week with lots of hours. How about we all do our best today. We can work over

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Answer: 868<n><n>Input: Stella and Twinkle are filling up a truck with a capacity of 6000 stone blocks at the rate of 250 blocks per hour per person. They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Where would there be a connection to go to another place? Choices:  A: wires B: electrical circuit C: computer network D: wall E: freeway<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The choice that makes most sense is option (E) - Freeway. If a connection exists, then we will have to go through somewhere else that would lead us to another place. If there is a connection between electrical circuit and computer networks, then these are actually devices that work independently of each other.<n>Option (A), Wires, would lead you to a place where there are more wires. Option (B), Electrical circuit, would make it clearer if where you're going has any connections to any electrical circuit or not. Option (C), Computer network, would suggest a connection between electrical circuits. Option (D), Wall, would just lead you to a connection in a wall such as where electrical circuits or wires are located.<n>So the correct answer is Option (E) - Freightway.<n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: kitchen cupboard B: maryland C: chicken D: tuna E: pantry<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>This was a very interesting read on how to handle this type of response. The following points will help to describe how to accomplish the task using Python:<n>1) When using a dict, it is important to use a list like `['Cabal, Poultry']`. I feel this is because I will read this input as a list as well as a dict and my first function will use the above dictionary input.<n>2) When using data as a set, I will use a dict that references values using tuple of 3 of the set. I will then reference my list as a tuple of ints like [`(1,[1])`]`(2, [2])` etc.<n><n>The way I structured the project was as follows:<n><n>```<n>def isSet(arg):<n>    if isinstance(arg, set):<n>        if isinstance(arg.__iter__(), dict):<n>            return True<n>        if isinstance (arg.__iter__(), list) and isinstance (arg.__getitem__ (), tuple):<n>            l = [item for item in arg[:1] + arg if 1 <= item < len(arg)]<n>            for i in l:<n>                if not isinstance(i.__getitem__[0], int):<n>                    return False<n>            return True<n>    return False<n><n>def inputTest(arg):<n>    listToTest = map (arg, [arg, arg, arg])<n>    return list(set(listToTest))<n><n>def main():<n>    print("""<n>        Please make your choices from the given options.<n>        After each question, select the <n>        answer which is most appropriate by checking the appropriate box. Once you have <n>        answered all the question, click \"Submit\" below. <n>        """)<n>    for i in range(0,8):<n>        print(i)<n>    dictTest1 = [['Cabal, ','Poultry'], [['Maryland'], [['Ricotta']] ]]<n>    print("1) What white meat goes well with cabal? (List a possible meal)")<n>    response = inputTest(dictTest1[0])<n>    print(response)<n>    print("\n")<n>    dictTest = [['pantry.', ['tuna']] ]<n>    print("2) What light meat goes well with pantry?

They work for four hours and are then joined by 6 other people who also work at the same rate. How many hours did filling the truck take?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Elijah drank 8.5 pints of coffee yesterday. Emilio drank 9.5 pints of water yesterday. How many cups of liquid did the two boys drink yesterday?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Doris works at the Widget Factory in the packing department. She puts 3 widgets in each carton, which are 4 inches wide, 4 inches long, and 5 inches tall. She then packs those cartons into a shipping box before sending it to the loading bay. The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:His running escape didn't last long once he tripped, perhaps he should've thought to what? Choices:  A: tie shoelace B: rest C: tiredness D: run longer E: sit down<n><n>### Response:		<n>His running escape didn’t last long once he (A) tripped, (B) perhaps he should’ve thought to (C) rest, (D) tiredness, (E) run longer or (F) sit down.<n>

In PHP, we will be using the email_address variable from function_email. We will put our variables in one of three arrays and put that array in a variable. We'll put that array variable in function_email and send an email. We'll also have to use PHP to check if the variable we pass the function the correct size. If it's larger than the correct size, we could run the function. If it's smaller than the right size, we should display what's wrong. Finally, if the sizes work, we should send an email to the recip

Two 2x4x8<n><n>### B:  If you sell your truck for $32,000 and you buy another truck for $33,000, how much money did you make or lose? Choices: A: lose B: gain C: zero D: make<n><n>### C: The first 5 numbers in the Fibonacci sequence (starting at zero) are: 0, 1, 1, 2, and 3. A number in the Fibonacce sequence, n, is the sum of the two before it. This sequence can go on forever and will never repeat itself. How many Fibonacci numbers are less than and equal to seventy?<n><n>### D: How much does 1000 quarters weigh?

The shipping boxes are 20 inches wide, 20 inches long, and 20 inches high. How many widgets get shipped in each shipping box?<n>Answer: 300<n><n>Input: Queenie earns $150 a day as a part-time clerk. She earns an additional $5 per hour as overtime pay. How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Illegitimate designer handbags will not have a certificate of what? Choices:  A: actions B: legal C: authentic D: logical E: legitimate<n><n>### Response:		<n>- The correct answer is D, 'legitimate'.<n><n>### Input :The total price of a cashmere sweater was $550.  The sweater was on sale for $150 off.  The price of the sweater before the discount was $400. With a discount of $150, what's the price after a discount?<n><n>### Response :<n>- The correct answer '650'.<n><n>###Input:Ann spends 200 hours preparing for her exam. If her exam takes 6 weeks to complete, how many study hours can Ann spare every week? Enter your answer as a positive integer.<n><n>### Response    <n>- Answer = 80, since the value should be an integer not a decimal<n><n>#### Test case example:<n>```<n>Problem<n>An apple is on sale at a store for $1.20. It was originally $1.60. You bought 3 of the apples. How much of a discount did you get?<n>Solution<n>3 apples were originally $4.80, but were now priced at $4 each.  You received 4 apples (1/3 of original number) and a 33% off discount. Thus, how much did you save?<n>$4.80*(1-.33)=$3.24<n>```<n><n>

How much will Queenie receive for working 5 days with 4 hours overtime?<n>Answer: 770<n><n>### Input:Everybody seemed to have a horse not just the regular gamblers, which event always brings out the biggest crowds to the sport? Choices:  A: race track B: kentucky derby C: american southwest D: triple crown E: horse derby<n><n>### Response:		<n>The Kentucky Derby is the biggest and most watched horse race every year. It has been held since 1875 at Churchill Downs in Louisville, Kentucky. The Derby typically attracts the largest audience of any horse-racing event, including the Breeders' Cup World Championship. It's held every the first Saturday in May on a track measuring 1 ¼ miles (2 km) in length. The race is open to thoroughbreds aged three years or older. The race has been held at Churchill Downs every year since its inception in 1875. It's run on a dirt track over 1 1/4 miles (2 km) with the winner receiving $1.86 million worth of bragging rights and 1,802 458-pound (826 kg) silver trophies.<n><n>### Input :Another major problem with plastic production that may require a significant policy change is that it takes so long for this plastic to fully break down and biodegrade. How long does it take for plastic to fully breakdown? Choices: 15 years 25 years 30 years 40 years 50 years 60 years 70 years 75 years 80 years 85 years 90 years 95 years<n><n>### Response :<n>Plastic is a synthetic material made from large molecules called polymers. These molecules are often long chains of smaller units called monomers. When monomers link up they form molecular chains of varying lengths or polymers. These polymers, in turn, form the large molecules and structural materials that make up plastics. But polymers are not very stable when they’re in the liquid (molten) state because they react with other chemicals. This creates the risk of toxic pollutants being produced. That means some plastics can take upwards of 400 years to biodegrade at a rate of about 1% per year<n><n>### Input. How much plastic waste does the oceans hold?  Choices: 2 million metric tons of of plastic 3 million metric tons of of  plastic 4 million metric tons of of of plastic 5 million metric tons of of or of plastic<n><n>### Response.

Choices:  A: move away from B: laying in C: sweating D: movement E: walking out of<n><n>### Response:		<n>Sweating<n><n>### Instructions:Write code that will solve the puzzles shown below.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Instructio:Write code that will use the following number of operations to convert a number from base n to base b.<n>- Convert the number to a binary string of length n(base n).<n>- Take its log base b by inserting 1's in the string at places where the value is greater than 1.<n>- Divide the string by the original number to get a remainder in base b.(The string is now a string of base b.)<n>- Convert the remainder to a binary string of log b bits.<n><n>### Implementation:<n><n>```python<n>n = int(input('Please enter an integer. : '))<n>b = int(input('Base : '))<n>result = 0<n>count = 1<n>if b!=1 and n > 0:<n>    while n!=0:<n>        x= count<n>        count=count>>1<n>        if x > n:<n>            break<n>        if count == 1:<n>            result = result * 2 + count<n>            continue<n>        result = result * 5 + (count&1)<n>    print(result)<n>else:<n>    result=n<n>print(result)<n>```<n><n>### Instuctions:Write a program that can count numbers from 1 to n and display it.<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>```python<n><n>def main():<n>    print(1)<n>    print("Program to display numbers from 1 to N, including the N\n")<n><n>if __name__ == "__main__":<n>    main()<n>```<n><n>## Solutions<n><n>---<n><n>### Solution<n>A = A/d<n>B = B/d<n>C = B = C<n>D = A<n><n>The following code is written with the understanding that no division should take place if dividing by 0, and if there is any input that is equal to 0 it will be caught before the division takes place.<n>```python<n><n>import math<n><n>def main():#Declare Main function<n>    print("Program that swaps two numbers")<n>    A = float(input('Please enter the first number :  '))<n>    B = float(input('please enter the second number :  '))

Choices:  A: very heavy B: video game C: news article D: card game E: lead pencil<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is A: very heavy<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Those who try to take a lead when dealing with a small paper are often not successful.  Why? Because the paper tends to jump and make it difficult to hold steady.  Weight of paper helps maintain a steady position in your hand by providing a more consistent level of pressure.  Thus, very heavy weight is the appropriate choice.<n><n>### Hint:You are an apprentice at Styx Woodshop and you want to be considered more than an apprentice.  Your boss, Zed, asks you to make a presentation to the upper management.  To make a good impression on them, you need to follow the instructions carefully.<n><n>### Input/Response:The woodshop produces wood blocks with a maximum of 3 square wooden blocks.  Zed asked you to make a presentation about the maximum size of blocks in a case of 6.<n><n>### Tip:There are six parts in a presentation that are commonly used by Zed:<n><n>1. You write a single note to the presentation.<n>2. The first three lines contain no more than three words each.<n>3. The fourth and fifth lines contain the same number of words, which contain a total of no more than six letters.<n>4. The final lines are called summary lines.  Each summary lines contains three elements: the name of a person, a verb, and the first and last letter of their name.<n>5. The number of summary lines and the number of words in them are the same.<n>6. Finally, you need to fill in the boxes with as many words as you need.<n><n>### Part I<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n>The maximum number of square wooden blocks is 26.<n><n>## Part II<n>1. You write one final note that summarizes the entire presentation.<n><n>## Part III<n>You complete the last seven boxes<n><n>## Part IV<n>You write 6-7 summary lines.<n><n>## Part V<n>You complete 6-10 boxes with as many words that are in the summary lines.<n><n>You are done!<n><n>### In this part of the examination, you are expected to work as a team with a partner of your choice<n><n>### Input for the first part<n>You are asked to write the correct word for each item given<n><n>###
